body.title:
Automation Developer (Power Platform)
Automation Developer (Power Platform) with verification
body.description:
About the job
Successful candidates will join our growing Power Platform Center of Excellent. The ideal candidate will collaborate with both business and technology partners to design, develop, and support Power Apps and Power Automate solutions, as well as promote and assist Citizen Development efforts. The role focuses on creating high-quality, user-friendly solutions and empowering line-of-business team members through education and support.

Responsibilities:

 Design, develop, and maintain applications and automations with Power Apps and Power Automate.
 Support line of business team members through Citizen Development initiatives.
 Create and maintain education and training material for citizen developers.
 Automate workflows and integrate third-party services with Power Platform connectors.
 Collaborate with business units to understand requirements and provide tailored solutions.
 Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance across applications and processes.
 Provide ongoing troubleshooting and support for Power Platform solutions.
 Deliver solutions using both Standard and Premium licensing features.
 Coordinate with team members, project management, internal and external technology partners to meet success and compliance objectives.
 Operate in accordance with USI Policies for the Information Security Program (PISP) and USI Standards for the Information Security Program (SISP).
 Stay current with industry and security updates and suggest improvements as appropriate.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

 Proven experience with Power Apps and Power Automate.
 Strong knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Azure integrations.
 Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
 Familiarity with low-code/no-code environments and Citizen Development best practices.
 Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
 Ability to manage multiple rapidly changing high visibility priorities.

Cyber Security Job Responsibilities:

 Operate in accordance with USI Policies for the Information Security Program (PISP) and USI Standards for the Information Security Program (SISP)
 Keep up to date with security updates and improvements. Implement improvements as appropriate.
 Protect systems against unauthorized access by appropriately defining access.
 Upgrade systems by implementing and maintaining security and technical controls.

USI is committed to providing a full-suite of competitive benefits for our growing population and its diverse needs. We offer a wide range of health, welfare and financial benefits including medical, wellness, dental and vision, 401(k), flexible spending and health savings accounts, short and long-term disability, life insurance and other unique employer-sponsored and voluntary programs. USI also offers a generous paid time off policy, paid family leave benefit as well as paid holiday time .

Salary Range: $100,000- $115,000. This is a bonus eligible position with a target incentive of 10%.

Deadline for applications: 3/10/25

body.description:
About the job
Job Title: Automation & Reporting Analyst (Power BI)

Job Description:

The Automation and Reporting Analyst is responsible for the implementation of automation initiatives, building reports, and iterating report design to best position our Service Delivery department. This role requires a natural analytical way of thinking and the ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users

Key Responsibilities:

Administration for automation platforms, including day-to-day configuration changes and maintenance.
Build dashboards and reporting for both management and individual contributor audiences that provide insight into team and individual performance as well as client and team health.
Assist with planning and executing toolset implementations, with end goals of creating scalability and improving the Service Delivery workflow.
Participate in automation strategy sessions both internally and with vendors of automation platforms.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visuals based on the metrics and KPIs that answer the questions that are important to the client.
Look for opportunities to automate and simplify complex or manual processes.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Build datasets for reporting use within common platforms including Bright gauge and PowerBI.
Meet with team members during the automation and report design processes to get feedback.
Develop and maintain documentation on automation and reporting platforms.
Manage report workspaces and user access.
Make recommendations for better ways to handle data where appropriate.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy across all reports and dashboards.


Additional Responsibilities:

Maintain accurate and real time timesheets, record complete and accurate notes of troubleshooting and communication with clients.
Receive mentoring and feedback from peers and others.
Where appropriate, escalate complicated issues to a more senior resource or other appropriate teams.
Review tickets with Analytics Manager.
Actively participate in team huddles, L10 meetings, one-on-one meetings, and any other team meetings.
Attend monthly training & team meetings as required.
Adherence to the guidelines set out in the Automation and Reporting Analyst Job Posting document.


Education Requirements, Skills, and Knowledge:

3+ years relevant experience is required.
Experience with PowerBI, PowerShell, and automation tools as well as working with an MSP is a plus.
Strong knowledge of current IT concepts, issues, practices, methodologies, and trends
Good problem solving and decision-making skills; ability to understand and analyze complex issues
Self-motivated, detail orientated, highly organized and able to handle a variety of tasks and responsibilities in an efficient manner with a high level of quality
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Very strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build effective working relationships.

body.title:
Junior Automation QA Tester
Junior Automation QA Tester
body.description:
About the job
Company Intro:

EveryMatrix is a leading B2B SaaS provider delivering iGaming software, content, and services. We provide casino, sports betting, platform and payments, and affiliate management to 200 customers worldwide.

But that's not all! We're not just about numbers; we're about people. With a team of over 1,000 passionate individuals spread across twelve countries in Europe, Asia, and the US, we're united by our love for innovation and teamwork.

Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to redefine the iGaming landscape, one groundbreaking solution at a time.

About the Job:

We are looking for a Junior Automation Quality Assurance (AQA) Specialist to join our team and play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our products. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, eager to learn, and has a foundational understanding of software testing.

What You'll Get to Do:

Define, develop, and implement quality assurance best practices and procedures, including test plans and test cases.
Utilize Playwright with JavaScript for automation testing, ensuring robust and efficient test scripts.
Perform comprehensive testing such as Black Box, Grey Box, Exploratory, Smoke, Regression, and End-to-End testing.
Conduct root cause analysis on identified defects, providing sufficient details for replication and resolution.
Perform API testing to ensure functionality and reliability.
Identify high-quality bugs based on department standards and accurately execute regressions on existing bugs.
Collaborate closely with developers to identify, reproduce, and resolve bugs.
Share constructive feedback with team members and stakeholders to improve product quality.
Accurately document and report issues with detailed steps to reproduce and observed behaviors.

What You Need to Shine:

1‚Äì3 years of experience in software testing.
Hands-on experience with Playwright and JavaScript.
Familiarity with issue tracking tools such as JIRA.
Experience working with test management tools like TestRail.
Knowledge of Java-based testing frameworks such as TestNG and Spring.
Proficiency in writing SQL database queries.
Solid understanding of software testing methodologies and procedures.
Familiarity with SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and STLC (Software Testing Life Cycle) processes.
Experience testing on various platforms, including mobile and desktop environments.
Attention to detail and accuracy in documenting issues, reproducing steps, and reporting observed behavior.

Here's What We Offer:

Start with 22 days of annual leave, with 2 additional days added each year, up to 32 days by your fifth year with us.
Stay Healthy: 10 sick leave days per year, no doctor's note required.
 Hybrid work schedule: 60% work from the office and 40% work from home per quarter (during your first 3 months, you'll be in the office full-time).
 Support for New Parents:
21 weeks of paid maternity leave, with the flexibility to work from home full-time until your child turns 1 year old.
4 weeks of paternity leave, plus the flexibility to work from home full-time until your child is 13 weeks old.
Our office perks include parking, on-site massages, and frequent team-building activities in various locations. And did we mention our amazing office space complete with its own pool and gym?

Benefits & Perks:

Daily catered lunch or monthly lunch allowance.
Private Medical Subscription.
Access online learning platforms like Udemy for Business and LinkedIn Learning, and a budget for external training.

At EveryMatrix, we're committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace where you can thrive both personally and professionally. Come join us and experience the difference! EveryMatrix is a member of the World Lottery Association (WLA) and European Lotteries Association. In September 2023 it became the first iGaming supplier to receive WLA Safer Gambling Certification. EveryMatrix is proud of its commitment to safer gambling and player protection whilst producing market leading gaming solutions.

body.title:
Marketing Automation Specialist
Marketing Automation Specialist
body.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
We delighted to be working with an award-winning global organisation, operating within the medical, data and scientific industries, as they seek a Marketing Automation Specialist to transform the use of their vast CRM system. Ideally we need somebody confident in communicating at all levels, with a keen interest in growing trends like AI, with a view to implementing products to streamline the performance of their teams.

As a proactive and dynamic Marketing Automation Specialist, this role offers you the opportunity to make a significant impact on strategy from the ground up, stakeholder buy-in, and leading the creation of their global AI & Automation strategy. This role could be viable for either an established specialist, or somebody looking to take the step up.

Position Overview:

You will be responsible for leading the business in artificial intelligence and automation marketing strategies to improve efficiency and productivity across the business (functions include Marketing, Sales, Finance, Contracts & Compliance, Business Services, Technology, L&D, HR and Talent Acquisition) globally.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, manage and optimise automated email, SMS, CRM and other multi-channel marketing campaigns to drive lead engagement.

Implement and manage marketing automation tools

Ensure seamless integration between CRM and marketing automation platforms

Monitor industry trends and best practices to keep campaigns up-to-date and innovative.

Work with all business units and stakeholders to plan tailored content

Develop and report on testing plans to improve automation performance

Provide monthly reports and insights on automation performance

Requirements:

Proven experience with marketing automation platforms such as HubSpot, Marketo, Salesforce, Pardot or similar.

Strong negotiation skills and passion for sharing automation benefits with multiple teams, across multiple sites to ensure buy in for data capture

Strong understanding of e-marketing, customer segmentation, and lead nurturing strategies.

Hands-on experience with data analysis and reporting using tools like Google Analytics, CRM systems, and automation platforms.

Experience with AI prompts when utilising AI-powered chatbots (i.e. ChatGPT and Bing Chat)There is a fantastic opportunity available for you to make your mark at a growing global business If you're a passionate marketing professional with expertise in automation, CRM or database marketing, with a drive to optimise and implement new marketing processes, we want to hear from you!

This role is based near Aylesbury and will require you to be in the office 3 days a week, with 2 from home (After an initial 1 month bedding in period). There is an excellent remuneration and benefits package, plus the opportunity to work with an award-winning organisation that truly values their staff.

Zero Surplus is East Anglia's premier recruitment agency, based just outside Cambridge our recruiters source staff for small and international businesses across Northants, Milton Keynes, Cambridgeshire and the East of England.

For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering as well as your required salary and notice period.

Please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV where possible, excluding textboxes or images. Any data we collect from you will be stored and processed in accordance with Zero Surplus' Privacy Policy

body.title:
Automation Engineer - Colombia
Automation Engineer - Colombia with verification
body.description:
About the job
About Us

We are a dynamic, rapidly growing global company and the innovators of service-driven supply chain planning software. For more than two decades, we‚Äôve been helping companies around the world overcome demand volatility and supply chain complexity so they can optimize inventory and deliver outstanding service to their customers and bottom line.

Our solutions have been recognized by customers globally and analyst firms such as Gartner for our ability to support service and inventory trade-offs, while dramatically improving planner productivity. ToolsGroup has been successfully deployed worldwide in more than 44 countries, and we have one of the highest customer retention rates in our industry.

About The Role

As an Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for building automation and tools to manage our cloud resources in Microsoft Azure. You will work on supporting our legacy environment of Windows VMs and MSSQL DBs, as well as developing infrastructure to support our next generation of SaaS products utilizing Kubernetes, Kafka, Elasticsearch and CosmosDB.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement automation solutions for managing Azure cloud resources.
Create and maintain infrastructure as code using ARM templates and Terraform.
Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts for automation tasks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Monitor and optimize the performance, reliability, and security of cloud infrastructure.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to cloud infrastructure and automation tools.
Document processes, procedures, and best practices for automation and cloud management.

Requirements:

Proven experience in managing and automating cloud resources in Microsoft Azure.
Proficiency in PowerShell scripting.
Strong knowledge of ARM templates and Terraform.
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) principles and practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently in a remote environment.

Additional Qualifications:

Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Knowledge of other cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) is a plus.
Relevant certifications in Azure or cloud technologies.

Why Join Tools Group?

Become part of the fast-growing ToolsGroup family! Our people are the engine that propels ToolsGroup to innovate - pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

You‚Äôll be surrounded by the very best and brightest, rewarded with competitive compensation, and career growth opportunities; becoming part of a company where teamwork and collaboration are paramount. Are you ready to take this exciting opportunity and develop your professional career within a growing company?

Then, send us your application with your CV (in English) today and join our team.

Applying to this job the candidate consents that his/her data are treated by ToolsGroup in compliance with the GDPR n. 2016/679

U.S. applicant notice: This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. ToolsGroup is CCPA/CPRA compliant.

body.title:
Test Automation Engineer
Test Automation Engineer
body.description:
About the job
Project

You would be a part of the team in Platform Unit within the Medical Division. The Platform Unit develops and maintains core solutions which are used by different products like lung ventilation devices, anesthesia devices, incubators and etc. To ensure the stability and the quality of core solutions within the Platform Unit, Test Automation Engineers support automated tests frameworks development and maintenance. 

Work

It would involve developing and executing automated tests, analyzing test results, detecting issues, and tracking root causes. In addition to that you might need to document assessments, technical issues, and solutions, to review requirement, etc. 

For this position, we are looking for Test Automation Engineer that would have such responsibilities as: 

Design and implement maintainable test automation architectures using established test design methods. 
Develop automated tests. 
Conduct automated software tests utilizing relevant test documentation. 
Support software development in analyzing test results. 
Review and assist in improving system design and test documentation from a testing perspective. 
Measure the quality of systems and software products and assist in improving product code. 
Provide support and advice to development teams.
 
Your Qualifications: 

You have several years of professional experience as an ISTQB Certified Tester or equivalent, ideally in a regulatory environment. 
Several years of professional experience in C++ programming. 
Advantageous to have experience in software development for embedded and real-time applications. 
Proficiency with common build systems (CMake) and continuous integration tools (Jenkins). 
Familiarity with test frameworks such as Google Test or CppUnit. 
Proficient with Git. 
Good command of English. 
You are a team player with an open and communicative nature and an independent and conscientious working style. 

Our Offer

Support - You will have a QuaDigi buddy by your side 
Flexibility - Flexible working hours, vacation schedule, remote or onsite work 
Online and offline training/workshops and other knowledge sharing possibilities

Snacks and fun activities in the office

Sport budget

body.title:
Automation Developer
Automation Developer with verification
body.description:
About the job
The Lab is a medium-sized, rapidly growing management consulting, automation implementation, and data science company in the Galleria area of Houston. We are a tight knit group that serves customers all around the country, and the world, by implementing solutions that solve emerging business problems. There is plenty of room for upward mobility at The Lab - but we earn it together. Work hours are 8-5 Monday through Friday.

We are seeking a robotic process automation developer who is passionate about developing to join the growing RPA practice. The person we seek has previous experience in developing UiPath RPA or Microsoft Power Automate. We will train the right individual if you do not have RPA experience - you just have to be willing to learn!

The RPA developer will work hand in hand with our data science teams on a daily basis to implement automations that drastically impact our client's businesses. The RPA developer will be responsible for gathering requirements, analyzing and documenting business processes, developing use cases and configuring RPA solutions.

Simultaneously, you will help senior management further standardize the service offerings and related work product with the objectives of: reducing bot implementation cycle time. As you become more familiar with our processes, you will also contribute to the refinement and extension of our findings and tools database/website which includes benchmarks, best practices, bot sequences and thousands of business process maps.

Working knowledge of the following is desired:
Excel
.Net
C#
Databases
Visio
KPIs
UiPath
Blue Prism
Automation Anywhere
Microsoft Power Automate

body.description:
About the job
We are hiring‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ QA Specialist

Quality analysis for RPA automation and integration solutions using UIs and APIs.
Writing and maintaining test documentation (Test Case, Check Lists).

Checking new functionality, fixed defects, regression testing after release.
Working with a ticketing system (Clickup).
Working with UI Path.
 The ideal candidate has:
Attention to detail. Ability to notice issues and inconsistencies in software behavior.
Logical thinking. Skill in breaking down complex software functions into smaller parts to identify potential points of failure.
Ability to investigate, analyze, and identify the root cause of defects to prevent recurrence.

body.title:
Engineer, II - Robotic Process Automation
Engineer, II - Robotic Process Automation with verification
body.description:
About the job
8901 - Corp Office West Crk - 12800 Tuckahoe Creek Parkway, Richmond, Virginia, 23238

CarMax, the way your career should be!

About This Job

At CarMax, we are industry disruptors. At the heart of our innovation is new digital products. Working on many different aspects of the customer experience, our Software Engineers research and discover new opportunities and shape products to fulfill them. From inception to completion, you will develop tools and technology, learning quickly from our spirit of experimentation. You will have a direct impact on improving the performance of our business and ensuring customers can buy the vehicles they want in a way that is right for them!

About The Team

The Financial Systems and Automation Technology teams at CarMax are responsible for the overall strategy, delivery and performance of robotic process automation technologies and other automated solutions across the organization. Our goal is to deliver transformative solutions with a focus on innovation, continuous improvement and driving efficiency as a part of CarMax‚Äôs back-office intelligent automation service model. 

Purpose Of The Role

As an Engineer II, you will work closely with business, product and technology teams to develop/configure and implement automation solutions and support the overall automation lifecycle.

What You Will Do ‚Äì Essential Responsibilities

Configuring and developing intermediate/advanced robotic process automations and objects using workflow principles in accordance with RPA industry standards.
Leveraging technical expertise to support automation opportunity identification activities, and deliver on the full software development lifecycle to include, but not limited to, building business/technical requirements; supporting business and technology teams in developing integration/user acceptance/end-to-end test strategy and execution; building deployment plans, creating release documentation and stabilization planning.
Mining and analyzing business processes and data to understand current state and provide high level analysis, value add recommendations and technical solutions to the Automation Technology Center of Excellence (COE) and business partners.
Working closely with process engineers, business teams/leaders and technology partners to ensure technical, business, quality, security, and compliance requirements are validated and are in accordance with CarMax‚Äôs best practices and standards.
Assisting the operational support control room lead with rotations in automation job monitoring and incident management, change requirements implementation and providing timely responses and solutions as required.
Lead, mentor, develop and train functional teams and less experienced team members using technical expertise, best practices and industry standards for robotic process automation development, the automation lifecycle and other intelligent automation solutions.
Participate in project planning activities to include sizing, sprints and retrospectives.
Supporting special projects as assigned by Senior members of the team and performing other duties as assigned.
Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation as scheduled (typically once every 6 weeks) and perform after hours support as needed.

Technical Qualifications / Requirements

Minimum of 3+ years of relevant experience, including 3+ years of successful delivery and/or support of robotic process automation technologies, VBA/.Net/SQL scripts, or other automation technology solutions
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
Blue Prism, UI Path or other robotic process automation technology experience required
Experience with object-based coding, macros and programming languages such as Microsoft SQL, Server SQL IUD statements, stored procedure techniques (SSIS), Python, Java, VBA and/or .Net and APIs required
Experience with web technology basic development experience utilizing HTML/CSS, Javascript, XML preferred
Experience with Microsoft (Excel, Access, PowerPoint) and Microsoft Azure required
Familiarity with intelligent automation solutions such as Power Platform, intelligent document processing and data analytics/visualization tools such as Alteryx
Knowledge of project management methodology (agile or waterfall) and the systems software development lifecycle
Excellent analytical, problem-solving skills with the ability to think logically and conduct root cause analysis
Ability to manage multiple tasks and/or projects simultaneously to deliver on tight timeframes, adapt to changing priorities and drive to achieve team goals independently
Ability to work independently to resolve discrepancies, defects, and issues with the understanding of system and business impact and when to escalate/partner respectively
Ability to consider long- and short-term impact of decisions
Translate business requirements into technical solutions
Ability to train, support and provide guidance to other associates
Up to date with industry/emergent technologies

Other Requirements

 Ability to embrace change
Ability to express opinions and innovative ideas while treating others with respect
Ability to challenge others and the status quo appropriately
Ability to build and maintain strong relationships throughout the organization and collaborate with other departments and teams
Ability to manage multiple tasks and/or projects simultaneously to deliver on tight timeframes and drive to achieve team goals independently
Ability to serve as a ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù person for the team as needed
Ability to think logically and conduct root cause analysis
Ability to take the time necessary to make the right choice; does so quickly if needed
Ability to identify potential issues and present solutions; partner on major decisions as appropriate
Ability to consider long- and short-term impact of decisions
Ability to train, support and provide guidance to other associates

Other Preferred Skills / Experience

Education preference: 4 year degree in IT related course of study
Accounting / Finance business process, systems and toolsets
Proficient in database creation and macros in Microsoft Access
Windows scripting and process execution
Linux familiarity (navigation, process execution, scripting)
Web Services, WCF and/or ASP.NET (Web API)
Microsoft Azure familiarity

Work Location and Arrangement: This role will be based out of the Richmond, VA Technology Innovation Center or Dallas Tech Hub in Plano, TX and have a Hybrid work arrangement.

Work Authorization: Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

About CarMax

CarMax disrupted the auto industry by delivering the honest, transparent and high-integrity experience customers want and deserve. This innovative thinking around the way cars are bought and sold has helped us become the nation‚Äôs largest retailer of used cars, with over 200 locations nationwide.

Our amazing team of more than 25,000 associates work together to deliver iconic customer experiences. Along the way, we help every associate grow their career and achieve their best, at work and in their community. We are recognized for our commitment to training and diversity and are one of the FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For¬Æ.

CarMax is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Upon an applicant's request, CarMax will consider reasonable accommodation to complete the CarMax Job Application.

About the job
Job Title: Quality Automation Specialist (12-Month Contract, Hybrid ‚Äì Financial Services)
Location: Edinburgh or London

About the Role
A leading financial services organization is seeking a talented Quality Automation Specialist to join their team on an initial 12-month contract. This role will focus on delivering high-quality automation testing solutions, with a particular emphasis on API testing and continuous integration within a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Automation Testing:

Skills & Experience Required
Hands-on experience with API automation testing tools, including Rest Assured and UFT.
Strong proficiency in Java programming and expertise in writing SQL queries.
Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Testing toolsets such as GitLab and GitLab Runner.
Experience in developing and working with Test Automation frameworks.
Desirable:
Familiarity with APIGEE and its role in API lifecycle management.
Experience using Splunk logs for troubleshooting and analysis.
Background in financial services or regulated industries.

What We Offer
Opportunity to work with a leading financial services client on cutting-edge automation testing initiatives.
A competitive day rate via an umbrella company.
Flexible hybrid working arrangements in Edinburgh or London.
Collaborative work environment focused on innovation and quality.

How to Apply
If you are a results-driven Quality Automation Specialist with expertise in API testing and automation, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to contribute to high-impact projects and drive quality improvements across critical systems.
This role is ideal for professionals with a passion for automation testing and continuous integration who thrive in a fast-paced, contract-based setting.

body.title:
Junior Automation QA Tester
Junior Automation QA Tester
body.description:
About the job
Company Intro

EveryMatrix is a leading B2B SaaS provider delivering iGaming software, content, and services. We provide casino, sports betting, platform and payments, and affiliate management to 200 customers worldwide.

But that's not all! We're not just about numbers; we're about people. With a team of over 1,000 passionate individuals spread across twelve countries in Europe, Asia, and the US, we're united by our love for innovation and teamwork.

Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to redefine the iGaming landscape, one groundbreaking solution at a time.

About The Job

We are looking for a Junior Automation Quality Assurance (AQA) Specialist to join our team and play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our products. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, eager to learn, and has a foundational understanding of software testing.

What You'll Get To Do

Define, develop, and implement quality assurance best practices and procedures, including test plans and test cases.
Utilize Playwright with JavaScript for automation testing, ensuring robust and efficient test scripts.
Perform comprehensive testing such as Black Box, Grey Box, Exploratory, Smoke, Regression, and End-to-End testing.
Conduct root cause analysis on identified defects, providing sufficient details for replication and resolution.
Perform API testing to ensure functionality and reliability.
Identify high-quality bugs based on department standards and accurately execute regressions on existing bugs.
Collaborate closely with developers to identify, reproduce, and resolve bugs.
Share constructive feedback with team members and stakeholders to improve product quality.
Accurately document and report issues with detailed steps to reproduce and observed behaviors.

What You Need To Shine

1‚Äì3 years of experience in software testing.
Hands-on experience with Playwright and JavaScript.
Familiarity with issue tracking tools such as JIRA.
Experience working with test management tools like TestRail.
Knowledge of Java-based testing frameworks such as TestNG and Spring.
Proficiency in writing SQL database queries.
Solid understanding of software testing methodologies and procedures.
Familiarity with SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) and STLC (Software Testing Life Cycle) processes.
Experience testing on various platforms, including mobile and desktop environments.
Attention to detail and accuracy in documenting issues, reproducing steps, and reporting observed behavior.

Here's What We Offer

Start with 22 days of annual leave, with 2 additional days added each year, up to 32 days by your fifth year with us.
Stay Healthy: 10 sick leave days per year, no doctor's note required.
 Hybrid work schedule: 60% work from the office and 40% work from home per quarter (during your first 3 months, you'll be in the office full-time).
 Support for New Parents:
21 weeks of paid maternity leave, with the flexibility to work from home full-time until your child turns 1 year old.
4 weeks of paternity leave, plus the flexibility to work from home full-time until your child is 13 weeks old.
Our office perks include parking, on-site massages, and frequent team-building activities in various locations. And did we mention our amazing office space complete with its own pool and gym?

Benefits & Perks

Daily catered lunch or monthly lunch allowance.
Private Medical Subscription.
Access online learning platforms like Udemy for Business and LinkedIn Learning, and a budget for external training.

At EveryMatrix, we're committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace where you can thrive both personally and professionally. Come join us and experience the difference! EveryMatrix is a member of the World Lottery Association (WLA) and European Lotteries Association. In September 2023 it became the first iGaming supplier to receive WLA Safer Gambling Certification. EveryMatrix is proud of its commitment to safer gambling and player protection whilst producing market leading gaming solutions.

Multitude is a listed European FinTech company, offering digital lending and online banking services to consumers, small and medium-sized businesses, and other FinTechs. The services are provided through three independent business units, which are served by our internal Banking-as-a-Service Growth Platform. Multitude‚Äôs business units are consumer banking (Ferratum), business banking (CapitalBox) and wholesale banking (Multitude Bank).

Multitude Group employs over 700 people in 25 countries and offers services in 16 countries, achieving a combined turnover of 212 million euros in 2022. Multitude was founded in Finland in 2005 and is listed on the Prime Standard segment of the Frankfurt Stock Exchange under the symbol 'FRU'.

As a Digitalization and Automation Specialist, you'll work closely with the Digitalization and Automation Expert to turn creative ideas into real solutions. If you're someone who enjoys solving problems, exploring new technologies, and improving processes, this role is for you! Internet allowance
Complete Government Mandated Benefits

Guaranteed 13th Month Pay equivalent to 1 of 12 of Gross Salary

IMPORTANT NOTE: As a Financial Technology company, we place high importance on our selection and vetting process. Successful candidates are required to allocate the necessary time to meet these requirements.

body.description:
About the job
SMEVentures is looking for a talented Process Automation Engineer to join our fast-growing company!

About SMEVentures

SMEVentures is the leading platform for entrepreneurship through acquisition (ETA) in Asia Pacific. We empower the growth and sustainability of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) by bridging the gap between retiring business owners and the next generation of entrepreneurial talent. Our approach honors the legacy of SMEs while injecting innovative strategies for future growth and success.

The Opportunity

Do you thrive on streamlining processes and solving complex problems with innovative solutions? SMEVentures is on a mission to bridge the generational gap in SME ownership across the Asia Pacific. We are seeking a passionate Process Automation Engineer to join our dynamic team and play a critical role in supporting the entrepreneurs we partner with. If you have a knack for using low code tools to engineer creative solutions, this is the opportunity for you!

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain efficient and scalable automated workflows that align with our business goals
Build and deploy solutions using Zapier and other low-code platforms, integrating with existing systems and APIs
Develop systems to monitor and analyze workflow performance, identifying areas for improvement and proactively addressing issues
Stay abreast of emerging automation technologies and trends to identify opportunities for further innovation


Requirements

A proven track record of automating complex processes using Zapier and other low code tools. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a product engineering mindset
Proficiency in agile development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum
Familiarity with APIs, data manipulation, and system integrations
Ability to write scripts or basic code in a relevant language (e.g., JavaScript, Python) as needed
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and manage multiple deadlines in a fast-paced working environment
Experience with database building is a plus


Benefits

A pivotal role in a pioneering company focused on the sustainability of SMEs in the Asia Pacific
A chance to work with a diverse, passionate team dedicated to making a real difference
Opportunities to grow and wear multiple hats in a supportive, dynamic environment

Ready to join us?

We're seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented Process Automation Engineer to join our growing team. If you're passionate about automation and love developing innovative solutions, we encourage you to apply!

body.title:
Marketing Automation Specialist
Marketing Automation Specialist
body.description:
About the job
We're looking for a Marketing Automation Specialist to join our LiveChat Marketing team at Text. If you're a proactive go-getter who thrives on leading campaign development and optimization, we want to hear from you. In this role, you'll refine our current workflows, create new ones, and leverage data to drive continuous improvement.

We are continually looking for new ways to achieve our goals, and we value individuals who thrive when working on a large scale‚Äîmanaging hundreds of thousands of contacts is something you excel at and genuinely enjoy.

If having a direct impact on a product that matters is something that suits you well, we can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Your Team

The LiveChat Marketing Team is a multidisciplinary crew of designers, content writers, developers, video and motion experts, and analytic minds. We‚Äôre responsible for the mechanics behind LiveChat‚Äôs marketing funnel: our product websites, landing pages, email newsletters, lead generation tools, analytics, CRO, and A/B testing, etc.

Our work happens in eight-week cycles (we work using the ShapeUp methodology). Every two months, we prioritize our tasks and pick objectives for the next iteration. We strive to shape our tasks before assigning them to avoid surprises. Marketing has to be agile, though. Sometimes, unforeseen issues arise, but we try to account for them during planning.

Things you‚Äôll do on a day-to-day basis:

Create and develop marketing automation campaigns for every stage of the user lifecycle, with a focus on user onboarding and retention
Define campaign scenarios, create workflows, and design customer touchpoints
Develop marketing automation strategies that integrate various communication channels (e.g., email, social media, SMS, etc.)
Craft highly personalized campaigns. 
Optimize and experiment with existing workflows to achieve the best performance
Track campaign performance and propose ideas for improvement
Assist the marketing and product teams in planning and developing new initiatives to enhance the user journey
Review marketing automation flows created by other teams across the company
Provide honest feedback on project ideas and identify potential challenges during the planning process


You might be a good fit for this role if: 

You are an expert in marketing automation tools (experience with HubSpot is a plus)
You have a great understanding of the SaaS business model
You are a self-starter and proactive specialist who can manage your own work as well as that of others
You have solid experience in crafting and building complex marketing automation flows
You are user-oriented, focusing on understanding and meeting the needs of your audience to create meaningful and engaging experiences
You love learning and trying new things. You stay up to date with all the new things in marketing automation. 
You have excellent communication skills. 
You have an eye for great design. 
You are results-oriented
You love learning and trying new things. You have strong opinions but they‚Äôre loosely held

In this role you will add value to PXP by:

You will play a pivotal role in driving transformative AI initiatives. At PXP, we‚Äôre embarking on an ambitious journey to integrate advanced automation and AI technologies, as we set the stage for a new era in payments and beyond.

This role provides the unique opportunity to explore innovative solutions, optimize processes, and shape our approach to intelligent automation. If you‚Äôre passionate about leveraging AI to create meaningful impact, we‚Äôd love to have you on board.

 A typical week as an AI Automation Manager / Engineer includes:

Lead Automation Projects: Design and implement automation solutions that enhance operational efficiency and drive business growth.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with various departments to identify areas for automation and deliver tailored solutions.
AI Integration: Explore and integrate AI technologies into automation workflows to enhance decision-making and process optimization.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor and refine automation tools and systems to ensure maximum performance and scalability.
Innovate and Experiment: Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and automation, applying them to drive innovation across the business.

We are looking for someone who has the following:

Experience in automation engineering, process optimization, or a related field.
Familiarity with automation tools and frameworks, as well as AI technologies and concepts.
A proactive mindset and the ability to adapt to an evolving technical landscape.
Strong problem-solving skills and a focus on delivering impactful solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

We would love someone to have any of the following:

Previous exposure to the payments or financial technology sectors.
A track record of delivering innovative solutions in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and their practical applications.

What we can offer you:

You will be joining us at a pivotal moment, where your contributions will directly shape our growth and future success, setting you on the ground floor of something extraordinary.

At PXP, we don‚Äôt just offer a job‚Äîwe offer an opportunity to build something extraordinary. You‚Äôll work on transformative projects, collaborate with passionate colleagues, and see the tangible impact of your efforts on our journey to becoming a global payments leader.

Growth Opportunities: Be part of a company with an ambitious vision, where your role evolves as the company grows.
Cutting-Edge Environment: Work with the latest tools and technologies to drive innovation in the payments industry.
Collaborative Culture: Join a supportive team that values creativity, collaboration, and shared success.
Flexibility: Benefit from hybrid or remote working options that allow you to balance professional and personal priorities.
Competitive Package: Enjoy a competitive salary, performance bonuses, and a range of benefits tailored to your location.
Impactful Work: Play a critical role in shaping the future of payments and making a difference for customers worldwide.

About us

PXP is a well-established and respected name within the card payment industry.

We boast an impressive and diverse client database across the globe and have over 30 years of experience within the payments space.

Our people are employed across our regional offices located in the UK, Austria, Bulgaria, India and the US.

PXP are a leading payment provider with a reputation of a reliable payment and acquiring platform as well as offering operational excellence and best in class service for all of our clients.

SMEVentures is the leading platform for entrepreneurship through acquisition (ETA) in Asia Pacific. Do you thrive on streamlining processes and solving complex problems with innovative solutions? SMEVentures is on a mission to bridge the generational gap in SME ownership across the Asia Pacific. Proficiency in agile development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum

Opportunities to grow and wear multiple hats in a supportive, dynamic environment

body.description:
About the job
Xometry (NASDAQ: XMTR) powers the industries of today and tomorrow by connecting the people with big ideas to the manufacturers who can bring them to life. Xometry‚Äôs digital marketplace gives manufacturers the critical resources they need to grow their business while also making it easy for buyers at Fortune 1000 companies to tap into global manufacturing capacity.

We are looking for a talented Marketing Automation & CRM Specialist to assist with our email and automation strategies. Your primary responsibilities will include creating and running campaigns end-to-end (mostly emails, but potentially also SMS, push notifications, and other channels), as well as managing contact databases.

If you have a passion for web technologies and can generate innovative ideas to drive growth, we‚Äôd love to meet you. Your role will involve reaching customers through both one-off and automated campaigns, delivering relevant and engaging content about our services.

Ultimately, you should be able to promote our brand effectively and ensure our customers remain informed, connected, and engaged with our company.

Functional Responsibilities

Produce and execute effective multi-channel campaigns including designing emails from templates and HTML, copywriting, translation coordination, media asset production, and collaboration with the creative team. 
Create and enhance various automated campaigns throughout the customer journey, including prospecting, nurturing, post-purchase, loyalty, retention, reactivation, surveys, etc.
Create and manage transactional emails.
Engage with various target audiences, including internal client teams and external media subscribers.
Manage and execute an email marketing calendar aligned with business objectives and internal stakeholder needs.
Run ad hoc campaigns across multiple countries, working closely with regional marketing managers.
Conduct A/B tests, analyse results, and provide insights for ongoing improvement.

Ideal Candidate

Experience in e-commerce email marketing, with a focus on highly targeted and segmented campaigns.
Strong experience with marketing automation, including creating efficient campaigns, experimenting with segmentation and targeting, and a deep understanding of digital marketing principles such as tracking and analytics.
Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms (e.g., ActiveCampaign, HubSpot, Braze, Iterable).
Ability to quickly edit, translate, and maintain multilingual campaigns.
Comfortable collaborating with regional marketing specialists and managing projects to meet deadlines.
Ability to produce design assets independently when needed.
Experience in developing, managing, and analysing large email marketing databases (multilingual experience is a plus).
Experience with integration and workflow automation tools (e.g., Zapier, Make/Integromat).
Familiarity with email marketing technologies for quality, responsive, and functional emails: HTML/CSS (specific to email), frameworks, design tools, and best practices.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret data.
Design skills (Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, and a good sense of design) are a strong plus.
Strong teamwork and project management skills.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Proficiency in English at C1 level or higher; other European languages are a strong advantage.

Personal qualities

Hands-on approach
Strong teamwork and project management skills
Good communicator
Exceptional attention to detail

Conditions

Remote full-time job
Corporate Laptop
Corporate free languages courses (English or German)
 Team spirit and friendly atmosphere: we work in an open, friendly and trusting environment that welcomes initiative. In the Xometry team, everyone is ready to help and support in difficult times, and we always celebrate victories together and appreciate the contribution of everyone.
Development opportunities: we are a fast growing company, each new task is an interesting challenge for the team.
We care: ongoing free of charge well-being activities for our people, charity projects worldwide.
Flexibility: speed and flexibility are some of our advantages, allowing us to achieve amazing results. We have flexible processes and planning, we can respond to rapidly changing conditions and remain effective in the face of uncertainty.
Onboarding: Well structured onboarding plan for new employees combining all in one process, technology, and systems components.

Here at Xometry we believe in diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness and providing a positive workplace for all.

Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Individual Contributor (Senior Level)

Location: Remote, USA
BENZAIT HQ is New Orleans, LA while the client is based on the East Coast.
Our organization operates on a remote-first model, with travel expectations as necessary for the position. Please be advised that we are unable to consider candidates residing in Alaska, California, or Colorado. We appreciate your understanding and encourage applicants from other locations to apply.

Overview:
The Senior AI & Automation Governance Consultant is part of the BENZAIT consulting practice, a rapidly growing business that serves clients across the healthcare ecosystem. We provide on-demand access to consulting talent with unparalleled experience and combine it with premium customer care and flexible contracting, allowing clients to focus on the demands of their business.

At BENZAIT, we are focused on empowering our clients to provide exceptional patient care each and every day. From health systems, hospitals, rehab centers to long-term care centers and at-home care capabilities ‚Äì our consultancy allows you to apply your skills in multiple settings while building your career and making a positive impact at premier healthcare systems across the nation.

The Senior Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Automation Governance Analyst will support the design, implementation, and management of governance frameworks for AI and Intelligent Process Automation (IPA) technologies, ensuring their ethical, transparent, and compliant use across our client‚Äôs organization. The analyst will work closely with the AI & Automation Governance Lead and various stakeholders to ensure adherence to governance policies, standards, and best practices.

Responsibilities:
A day in the life of the Senior AI & Automation Governance Consultant:
Project Support: Assist in the planning, execution, and evaluation of AI and automation projects from a governance perspective. Ensure that projects adhere to governance frameworks and comply with relevant policies and standards.
Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including clinical, operational, and IT departments, to promote and enforce governance practices. Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and provide guidance on governance-related issues. Support the AI & Automation Governance Program by managing the AI & Automation Governance Committee and other key stakeholder relationships / groups (e.g., clinical champions, relationships with IT departments, and the cross functional AI & Automation Working Group). 
Documentation and Record Keeping: Maintain comprehensive documentation of governance frameworks, policies, standards, and procedures. Ensure accurate and up-to-date record keeping for compliance and audit purposes. Promote awareness of governance policies and standards.
Governance Framework Development: Assist in the design and implementation of governance frameworks for AI and automation technologies. Develop and maintain policies, standards, and best practices to ensure the ethical, secure, and compliant use of AI and automation.
Compliance and Risk Management:  Monitor and ensure compliance with in-house policies and external regulatory requirements and industry standards related to AI and IPA. Manage AI Intake & Risk Assessment processes. Perform AI Risk Assessments for each vendor and in-house solution that involves AI.
Performance Measurement and Reporting: Work with the AI Return on Investment (ROI) Analyst to identify quantitative and quantitative metrics for appropriately measuring effectiveness for each AI use-case. Update reports on governance activities, compliance status, and risk assessments. Utilize data analytics to identify trends, measure ROI, and support data-driven decision-making.
 Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for improving governance frameworks and processes. Stay updated on emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in AI governance.
 Qualifications & Skills Required:
Minimum of 5 years of experience in AI, automation, data governance, or a related field.
Proven experience in developing and implementing governance frameworks.
Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and industry standards related to AI and automation.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Proficiency in data analytics tools and techniques.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient computer skills that may include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.
Must be able to travel - 1 week a month to client site
 Education/Certifications:
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field or a minimum of 5 years of experience in AI, automation, data governance, or a related field.
Master‚Äôs Degree preferred
Relevant certifications in AI, data governance, or risk management are a plus.
 Salary:
W2 Hourly Rate: $45.00-$58.00 (US) per hour. The salary range for this role considers the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skills, experience, training, licensure and certifications, practice area, and other business and organizational needs.
 Benefits Offered (W-2 Consulting Positions):
Full Medical Coverage: Paid medical, dental, vision for the consultant.
Generous 401(k) match: Invest in your future with our 401k matching program
Workplace Flexibility: Enjoy the flexibility of remote work options
Internet and wellness stipend.
Collaborative Team Culture: Be part of a supportive and innovative team
Innovative Technologies: Opportunity to work at the forefront of Data and AI technologies.

At BENZAIT, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Please be vigilant regarding job scams. We advise all candidates to apply directly through our official careers page. Our team will use email addresses with the domain __@benzait.com.

**To be considered for this role apply directly to: https://jobs.gusto.com/postings/benzait-senior-ai-automation-governance-consultant-analyst-6beb9802-e442-478c-84d5-2c260c471cfd

body.title:
Process Automation Engineer
Process Automation Engineer
body.description:
About the job
SMEVentures is looking for a talented Process Automation Engineer to join our fast-growing company!

About SMEVentures

SMEVentures is the leading platform for entrepreneurship through acquisition (ETA) in Asia Pacific. We empower the growth and sustainability of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) by bridging the gap between retiring business owners and the next generation of entrepreneurial talent. Our approach honors the legacy of SMEs while injecting innovative strategies for future growth and success.

The Opportunity

Do you thrive on streamlining processes and solving complex problems with innovative solutions? SMEVentures is on a mission to bridge the generational gap in SME ownership across the Asia Pacific. We are seeking a passionate Process Automation Engineer to join our dynamic team and play a critical role in supporting the entrepreneurs we partner with. If you have a knack for using low code tools to engineer creative solutions, this is the opportunity for you!

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain efficient and scalable automated workflows that align with our business goals
Build and deploy solutions using Zapier and other low-code platforms, integrating with existing systems and APIs
Develop systems to monitor and analyze workflow performance, identifying areas for improvement and proactively addressing issues
Stay abreast of emerging automation technologies and trends to identify opportunities for further innovation


Requirements

A proven track record of automating complex processes using Zapier and other low code tools. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a product engineering mindset
Proficiency in agile development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum
Familiarity with APIs, data manipulation, and system integrations
Ability to write scripts or basic code in a relevant language (e.g., JavaScript, Python) as needed
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and manage multiple deadlines in a fast-paced working environment
Experience with database building is a plus


Benefits

A pivotal role in a pioneering company focused on the sustainability of SMEs in the Asia Pacific
A chance to work with a diverse, passionate team dedicated to making a real difference
Opportunities to grow and wear multiple hats in a supportive, dynamic environment

Ready to join us?

We're seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented Process Automation Engineer to join our growing team. If you're passionate about automation and love developing innovative solutions, we encourage you to apply!

body.description:
About the job
Description

JOB TITLE: Automation & API Specialist (Contract-to-Hire)

DEPARTMENT: IT / Digital Transformation

REPORTS TO: Chief Information Technology Officer

FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt

Bay Cities, an Employee-Owned Company, is the leading creative packaging and display partner to brand

marketers, retailers and e-commerce. Our passion, experience, technology and consumer insights move

product and drive sales.

Our Mission

Our Passion Powers Your Product

Our Values

Creativity: Our ideas create Client success.

Passion: We have heart with a Customer Service attitude.

Integrity: We honor our business & planet with sustainable practices.

Responsible: We own it!

Safe: Our safe work habits protect us all.

Fun: We take our work seriously- not ourselves

Summary

As an Automation & API Specialist (Contract-to-Hire), you will serve as a technical expert in designing,

implementing, and optimizing automation solutions within the Microsoft 365 ecosystem. This role involves

integrating APIs, utilizing Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate, Power BI, Power Apps), and

leveraging Azure AI Foundry and Copilot Studio to address business needs and operational challenges.

This is a contract-to-hire position with potential for full-time employment based on performance.

JOB FUNCTION/PURPOSE

 Solution Development: Partner with stakeholders to identify and address operational

inefficiencies using Power Platform tools and automation.

 API Integration: Build and maintain API integrations within the Microsoft 365 environment to

enable data flow between systems.

 AI & Automation: Leverage Azure AI Foundry and Copilot Studio to implement AI-powered

solutions, enabling predictive insights and decision-making.

 Power Platform Expertise: Create and deploy solutions using Power Automate, Power BI, and

Power Apps to enhance productivity and streamline processes.

 Collaboration: Work closely with departments to ensure successful implementation, adoption, and

training for automation tools.

 Governance & Security: Ensure solutions comply with security policies and adhere to Microsoft

365 governance best practices.

 Documentation: Develop detailed technical and user-facing documentation for integrations,

workflows, and solutions.

Experience

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCIES

 3+ years of experience in API development, automation, or process improvement.

Automation & API Specialist (Contract-to-Hire) Issued: 1/15/2025 Page 2 of 3

 Strong expertise with Microsoft 365 tools, especially Power Platform (Power Automate, Power BI,

Power Apps).

 Hands-on experience with Azure AI Foundry and/or Copilot Studio is highly desirable.
 Proven ability to develop and maintain API integrations in enterprise environments.
 Strong understanding of Microsoft 365 compliance, security, and governance best practices.

Skills

 Proficient in automation and workflow design within Microsoft 365.
 Expertise in API protocols (REST, SOAP) and integration development.
 Strong analytical skills to translate business challenges into technical solutions.
 Effective communicator with the ability to collaborate across technical and non-technical teams.
 Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD practices within a Microsoft

ecosystem.

Education

 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.

Preferred Skills

 Experience working in manufacturing or packaging environments is a plus.
 Knowledge of advanced analytics and data visualization in Power BI.
 Familiarity with Azure-based AI tools and machine learning workflows.
 Understanding of Microsoft Teams and SharePoint integration capabilities.

Work Environment

 Fully remote, with occasional on-site visits if necessary (California-based).
 Contract-to-hire with competitive hourly rates based on experience.

Core Competencies

 High ethical standards. Models and supports organization‚Äôs goals and values; adapts to changing

conditions; demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles. Consistently conducts themselves

in an honest and trustworthy manner. Does not pursue their own individual objectives to the

detriment of company goals. Sets an example for others to follow. Does the right thing.

 Demonstrates energy and passion about what they do and knows how to balance work and fun. Is

generally optimistic and upbeat; fun to be around. Has a strong belief and zeal for the industry, the

job, and the company. Conveys energy and intensity at work with a capacity for keeping others

enthusiastic and involved.

 Operates with a customer service orientation internally and externally. Works to positively build the

Bay Cities brand in everything he/she does. Builds strong, positive relationships with all

stakeholders.

 Acts as an owner of the business and instills that same attitude and level of action in others. Is

proactive in taking responsibility for all outcomes/results and avoids ‚Äòpointing fingers‚Äô. Helps to

create and maintain a strong feeling of belonging in the immediate and overall team.

 Regularly involves others in decisions that affect their job or work environment. Demonstrates cooperation and trust with colleagues and teams across organizational boundaries. Participates as a

team player and establishes strong working relationships to deliver positive results.

 Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize, balance, and manage multiple

efforts with strong results/goal orientation. Uses time effectively, prioritizes and organizes work

flow; can orchestrate multiple activities at once. Agility and personal adaptability with the ability to

successfully manage multiple priorities with a high sense of urgency in a rapidly changing

environment.

 Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates

suggestions for improving work. Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and

versatile learner; open to change; strives for continuous improvement of self and processes.

 Excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills with the ability to convey

information and ideas in a variety of media, tactful, confident, at all levels, internal and external.

Automation & API Specialist (Contract-to-Hire) Issued: 1/15/2025 Page 3 of 3

Must have strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage multiple projects in a rapidly changing

environment.

Other

 US Persons Only (US citizens, lawful permanent residents, refugee or asylee ‚Äì all require proper

identification and documentation).

 Up to 10% local travel.
 Physical and Environmental Requirements: While performing the duties of this Job, the employee

is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and sit. The

employee is occasionally required to walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee must

occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include

close vision and color vision.

 Work environment includes front-office and manufacturing. The noise level in the work environment

is usually moderate.

 Pre-Employment Verifications: Must pass background and reference checks, drug screen, and

physical examination prior to employment.

body.title:
Automation Test Engineer
Automation Test Engineer
body.description:
About the job
IntelliBridge is looking for a hands-on Automation Test Engineer to join our growing team!

The role operates in a SAFe based Agile environment and requires an understanding of the full software lifecycle, including DevSecOps implementations, Software Development, System Integration, Infrastructure Management and Cyber Security.

Position Overview

The selected candidate must be knowledgeable and experienced as a Quality Assurance Automation Test Engineer for web applications, UI, and server-based application software testing, having experience both creating and maintaining software automation test scripts (API and UI). Likewise, the candidate must have a working knowledge of software engineering concepts such as Agile methodologies, software development standards, quality assurance standards, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), interpretation of product requirements, test plan and test case development, testing of software functionality, product installation, P&L, and usability (508 compliance experience a plus) testing.

Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:

Creating, maintenance and evaluation of software automation test scripts (including incorporation of dynamic test data) for both UI and API
Gathering and validating application functional/performance/load requirements
Creation and maintenance of test plans and test cases
Execution, as required, of manual and automated software testing in areas involving installation, functional, performance and load, integration, and regression testing
Management of defects within a corporate defect tracking system such as Jira
Documentation of process improvements regarding best practices regarding test automation
Creation of test reports using Jira
Maintenance of all test documentation
Coordination and prioritization of test development activities and the ability to work with multiple scrum teams and software projects are also critical for the selected candidate. Candidate must have the ability to troubleshoot independently both software and operating system level installation and configuration issues


Required Skills And Competencies

Production software development experience with 2-3 structured programming languages such as .Net and Java
Experience test automating .NET and CRM (Pega) applications using behavior driven test automation framework such as Gauge (Selenium)
Experience with quality assurance practices and testing methodologies
Experience writing test plans, test cases development, and execution
Experience developing, executing, and maintaining automated test scripts
Experience with writing automation test scripts for endpoints using tools such as ReadyApi or Postman
Experience with both SOAP based and RESTful web APIs
Experience with MS SQL Server
Experience with branching, pull requests, merging, and GIT commands
Experience deploying in CI/CD and using Build Pipelines
Demonstrated documentation and reporting experience
Experience with commercial defect management systems
Experience working within an Agile Development Environment
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills
Basic understanding of program interfaces, services, databases, messaging, files systems, and other program objects
A minimum of 5+ of structured software quality assurance engineering experience is required
3+ years of hands-on experience with the development of automated test scripts, execution of test cases and reporting and dissemination of test results
A bachelor‚Äôs degree--preferably in Computer Science, Software Engineering, similar discipline, or equivalent work experience is required


Desired Skills

508 Compliance testing
Performance & Load testing using LoadRunner or comparable
Experience writing production JavaScript, HTML, XML, XSLT
Experience with Visual Studio Code and/or IntelliJ
Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) experience


Education And Experience

A minimum of 5+ years of structured software quality assurance engineering experience is required.
3+ years of hands-on experience with the development of automated test scripts, execution of test cases and reporting and dissemination of test results.
A bachelor‚Äôs degree- preferably in Computer Science, Software Engineering, similar discipline, or equivalent work experience is required.


The successful candidate is subject to a background investigation by the US government and must be able to meet the requirements to hold a position of public trust.

 We are driven by our commitment to our clients and to our employees. If you are looking for a new opportunity, we would love to have you join our team!

body.title:

body.description:

Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed, and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search.

For one of our clients, we are looking for a Marketing Automation Specialist, working remotely from Latin America.

As a Marketing Automation Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in driving client success by combining technology with strategic marketing solutions. body.title:
QA Automation
QA Automation with verification
body.description:
About the job
About us:

A fast-moving team, senior enough to assure effectiveness, but young enough to be flexible and transparent. We started out in 2000 and we‚Äôre a company with a soul, driven by our values and dedicated to fulfilling our mission to offer world class services, by continuous learning. With active investment in our people's professional development and with the creative-InCrys-touch, we support our clients throughout the project's life cycle, providing end-to-end technology solutions for mission critical systems, products and services.

We're looking for a QA Engineer to join our dynamic and collaborative team! If you're experienced with tools like Playwright and enjoy working with Gherkin-based scenarios, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

What You'll Be Doing:
Automating Excellence: Develop and maintain automated UI test scripts using Playwright, with a focus on scalability and reliability.
Ensuring Quality: Identify areas for improvement and work towards achieving comprehensive test coverage.
Collaborating with Teams: Work in agile teams, integrating automated tests into our CI/CD pipelines and ensuring smooth delivery cycles.
Driving Behavior-Driven Development: Collaborate with product owners, developers, and stakeholders to define and implement BDD scenarios.
Hands-On Testing: Write Gherkin-based scenarios and translate them into automated tests. Conduct manual testing when needed to verify feature completeness and correctness.
Mentorship: Share your expertise by mentoring and supporting junior QA engineers in adopting automation best practices.
Staying Agile: Actively participate in agile ceremonies and contribute to a culture of continuous improvement.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:
Playwright Pro: Hands-on experience with Playwright, preferably using TypeScript.
BDD Expert: Proven skills in writing Gherkin-based scenarios and implementing them effectively.
Tech Savvy: A solid understanding of web technologies and RESTful APIs.
Team Player: A collaborative mindset, great communication skills, and a desire to help your team succeed.

What We Offer:
  Private medical insurance - for the employee; can be extended for other family member
Work from home - according to InCrys internal policy

 We are an equal opportunities employer, and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. InCrys is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

body.title:
