body.description:
About the job
Title: Quality Assurance Automation Tester

Clearance: Public Trust

Location: Washington DC Metro Area or Fort Collins/Denver Area

Overview

IntelliBridge is an award-winning national security company looking for a Quality Assurance Automation Tester to support our contract with the USDA Conservation Solution. This role operates in a SAFe based Agile environment and requires an understanding of the full software lifecycle, including DevSecOps implementations, Software Development, System Integration, and Cyber Security.

As a direct employee of IntelliBridge, you would receive a benefit package that includes health/dental/vision insurance coverage, 401K with company match, PTO & paid holidays, and annual tuition/training assistance. For more information, please visit our website .

Clearance

Public Trust 


Mandatory Selective Service registrants that have not registered for the Selective Service will be required to provide a Selective Service Status Information Letter as part of their onboarding package. More information can be found at  https://www.sss.gov/ . 

Responsibilities/Duties

Develop test plans and test cases
Manual and automated testing and script development to validate software functionality and installation to include functional, integration and regression testing
Defect management and error tracking
Test report documentation
Able to independently troubleshoot software issues, coordinate and prioritize testing activities
Comfortable working in an Agile Development environment


Required Qualifications

Must be eligible to work in the United States 
A Bachelor of Science (BS) degree in related field or equivalent work experience can be substituted instead of a degree.
Minimum 3 years‚Äô experience with Quality Assurance practices and Testing Methodologies
Basic understanding of program interfaces, services, databases, messaging, files systems, and other program objects.
Experience with formal testing of complex web-based software systems
Experience with executing functional, usability, and deployment testing
Experience documenting test cases and reporting test results using a test case/defect management system (eg. Jira and Xray)
Experience testing in an agile development environment
Excellent analytical and problem determination skills
Hands on experience preparing Test Plans and Test Cases based on product requirements 
Experience with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium/Gauge/Maven with Java
Experience with SOAPUI or ReadyAPI in a Swagger environment
Experience with git source control 
Experience testing Web Services, API endpoints, and Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) 
Proficient creating Automation Scripts (i.e. Java [Selenium, Gauge], Dos, Bash, Python)
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and querying SQL databases


Preferred Qualifications

A SAFe certification or willingness to complete certification on hire
Experience with Jira, Xray, Confluence and Miro 
Experience testing products developed within the Pega framework
Experience testing Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act design compliance


About Us

IntelliBridge delivers IT strategy, cloud, cybersecurity, application, data and analytics, enterprise IT, intelligence analysis, and mission operation support services to accelerate technical performance and efficiency for Defense, Civilian, and National Security & Federal Law Enforcement clients.

body.title:
Zoho Sales Funnel Automation Specialist (ZR_19214_JOB)
Zoho Sales Funnel Automation Specialist (ZR_19214_JOB)
body.description:
About the job
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Zoho Sales Funnel Automation Specialist to help streamline and automate our sales and marketing processes. The ideal candidate will have a strong working knowledge of Zoho and be responsible for creating drip campaigns and setting up triggers based on website form submissions. They will work closely with our team to organize audience details, timelines, and messaging into campaigns, ensuring that contacts are accurately added to our email and text message lists.

Job Highlights
Hourly Rate: PHP 300
Schedule: Eastern Time
Work Arrangement: Work from home
Contract: Independent Contractor
Side note: Since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an ‚ÄúIndependent Contractor‚Äù arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.

Key Responsibilities:
Automate sales funnels within Zoho, including creating drip campaigns and setting up triggers based on data provided from form submissions on our website.
Manage and organize audience segments, timelines, and messaging according to spreadsheets provided.
Design and implement campaigns in Zoho based on the services requested (e.g., Stork Rental, Yard Signs, Balloons, etc.) and specified timelines.
Ensure all contacts are accurately sorted into the correct text and email lists, as defined in the provided spreadsheets.
Work with spreadsheets that outline service types, timelines, and messaging to create automated workflows that engage leads and clients with the appropriate follow-up actions.
Set up triggers for specific contacts (e.g., schools, alumni, country clubs) based on their previous interactions and status (e.g., leads, active accounts, closed deals).
Design reminder sequences for follow-ups, such as sending a text message reminder to leave a review 3 days after the service has been completed.
Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to ensure campaigns and automations align with business goals and customer needs.
Troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to the setup and execution of campaigns or automations within Zoho.
Requirements
Proven experience with Zoho CRM, including knowledge of setting up drip campaigns, triggers, and automations.
Strong understanding of sales funnels and marketing automation.
Experience working with spreadsheets to organize data for use in automated systems.
Ability to interpret and apply specific audience and timeline details to create targeted campaigns.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to manage multiple campaigns and deadlines efficiently.
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
Experience in event planning, rentals, or related industries is a plus, but not required.

Independent Contractor Perks
Permanent work-from-home
HMO Coverage on Eligible Locations
Immediate hiring
Steady freelance job

Reminder
Kindly apply directly to the link provided; you will be redirected to BruntWork‚Äôs Career Site. Complete the initial requirements, including the voice recording, pre-screening assessment, and technical check of your computer/device.

body.description:
About the job
Become a part of our caring community and help us put health first

Do you have experience with data integration activities utilizing the Salesforce CRM and cloud platforms and consider yourself detail-oriented, organized, and a strong communicator? Do you have a desire to work for a Fortune 50 Company with great benefits? Then we have a role for you! Humana is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analysis Professional who is highly skilled in data integration with a focus on the Salesforce CRM and Snowflake and has the ability to be a strong communicator and collaborator working with stakeholders across multiple enterprise teams.

The Senior Business Systems Analysis Professional will be responsible for managing and executing data integration activities between Salesforce CRM and the Snowflake cloud platform. Involves collaboration with various stakeholders across multiple enterprise teams to gather requirements, draft data usage agreements, and share data in a compliant manner. Responsible for making independent decisions related to work prioritization and timeline commitments utilizing Agile methodology. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction.

Support data integration activities between Salesforce CRM, the Snowflake cloud platform, and other enterprise systems
Manage secure, efficient data sharing solutions to downstream consumers
Partner with Retail Sales Leaders, operations teams, subject matter experts, training, and IT Teams to develop and deploy continuous improvement initiatives across the organization focused on data integration and sharing
Collaborate with business stakeholders and translate those into technical requirements
Follows and support data governance best practices within the team and across MarketPoint
Cultivate relationships with multiple internal Business and IT partners
Initiate and facilitate meetings to identify, document, and prioritize business technology needs that align with department deliverables and organizational goals
Champion the customer by accurately representing their prioritized needs in the requirements, development, and testing phases of each project
Implement Change Management processes as needed to maintain accurate requirements dependencies and documentation

Required Qualifications

Use your skills to make an impact 

Experience in integrating Salesforce CRM with cloud platforms like Snowflake for the purpose of data enrichment and sharing
Experience using Power BI, T-SQL, PL-SQL, Toad or Azure to analyze and interpret data
5+ years of experience in information technology, process management, business administration, communication, or a related field
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes, data integration, and in SQL or other scripting for data transformation
Proven ability to work with cross-functional teams and manage medium to large scale integration projects
Knowledge of data governance, security, and compliance frameworks
Proficiency in documentation tools and software such as Microsoft Office Suite, Lucidchart, or similar
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for stakeholder engagement and requirement gathering
Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's, MBA or other Advanced Degree
Certification in Salesforce (e.g., Salesforce Integration Architecture Designer)
Certification in Snowflake (e.g. SnowPro Core)
Certifications in data engineering or cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP)
Certification in process improvement methodologies (e.g., Six-Sigma, Lean)
Experience with Agile development processes and user story writing
Certification in project management (e.g., PMP)
Working knowledge of ad-hoc query tools and data repositories that support data extraction and manipulation
Ideal candidate will live w/in 50 miles of Louisville KY
Live in KY, IN, OH or TN 

Additional Information

Some nights or weekends may be required to support production turn activities.
To ensure Home or Hybrid Home/Office associates‚Äô ability to work effectively, the self-provided internet service of Home or Hybrid Home/Office associates must meet the following criteria:
At minimum, a download speed of 25 Mbps and an upload speed of 10 Mbps is recommended; wireless, wired cable or DSL connection is suggested

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Pay Range

The compensation range below reflects a good faith estimate of starting base pay for full time (40 hours per week) employment at the time of posting. The pay range may be higher or lower based on geographic location and individual pay will vary based on demonstrated job related skills, knowledge, experience, education, certifications, etc.

$80,900 - $110,300 per year

This job is eligible for a bonus incentive plan. This incentive opportunity is based upon company and/or individual performance.

Description Of Benefits

Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, ‚ÄúHumana‚Äù) offers competitive benefits that support whole-person well-being. Associate benefits are designed to encourage personal wellness and smart healthcare decisions for you and your family while also knowing your life extends outside of work. Among our benefits, Humana provides medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, time off (including paid time off, company and personal holidays, volunteer time off, paid parental and caregiver leave), short-term and long-term disability, life insurance and many other opportunities.

About Us

Humana Inc. (NYSE: HUM) is committed to putting health first ‚Äì for our teammates, our customers and our company. Through our Humana insurance services and CenterWell healthcare services, we make it easier for the millions of people we serve to achieve their best health ‚Äì delivering the care and service they need, when they need it. These efforts are leading to a better quality of life for people with Medicare, Medicaid, families, individuals, military service personnel, and communities at large.

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Humana not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or veteran status. It is also the policy of Humana‚ÄØto take affirmative action to employ and to advance in employment, all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status, and to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements. This policy shall apply to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including apprenticeship, at all levels of employment.

body.description:
About the job
Role Summary

As the Sr. Automation & Controls Engineer, you will be responsible for integrating new construction projects for renewable energy power plants, primarily focusing on BESS/Solar/Hybrid/Substation systems. You'll be part of a team dedicated to delivering Digital/Automation solutions to customers.Your role will focus on project readiness and the commissioning phase through project close-out. This includes support from the early stages, including the engineering phase, to ensure quality project delivery and expedite start-up, commissioning, and close-out.The scope encompasses support for automation/logic controllers, HMI/SCADA, Industrial Networking, IoT solutions, and Metering/IED connectivity.While new plant construction will represent most responsibilities, you'll also provide after-sales customer expert support for incidents and troubleshooting.

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities



Commissioning and Automation Integration

Support/review automation system design
Contribute to automation system testing process development
Develop and track commissioning plans and schedules
Lead automation systems commissioning execution
Coordinate activities with stakeholders and vendors/contractors
Track and resolve automation systems commissioning issues
Ensure cybersecurity best practices application and verification
Ensure coordination and compliance at project hand-off
Collect and produce commissioning documentation
Coordinate/deliver automation solutions training
Support O&M team in the project transition phase

System Configuration and Troubleshooting

Perform/coordinate hands-on configuration and troubleshooting for: 
Automation/Instrumentation devices
SCADA applications & infrastructure
Industrial communications & networks

Bachelor's degree in Engineering

Technical documentation skills

Advanced proficiency in: 
Automation system configuration (PLC, SEL RTAC, Metering, IEDs)
Industrial communications (Modbus, DNP3, OPC-UA, MQTT)
SCADA platforms (SEL HMI, Ignition)
Industrial networks communications and systems

body.title:
Cloud Automation Engineer
Cloud Automation Engineer
body.description:
About the job
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Kforce Technology Staffing, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Kforce is looking to hire a Cloud Automation Engineer to support one of our clients in their Cloud Infrastructure team.

Responsibilities:

 Design, develop, and implement automation solutions for cloud infrastructure and services
 The Cloud Automation Engineer will create and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or ARM templates
 Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment and management of cloud resources
 Collaborate with development and operations teams to identify automation opportunities and streamline processes
 Implement and manage configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Chef) to ensure consistency and compliance
 Monitor and optimize the performance of automated systems and processes
 Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to automation scripts and tools
 Document automation processes, procedures, and best practices
 The Cloud Automation Engineer will ensure security and compliance requirements are met through automated solutions
 Stay up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies and automation trends

REQUIREMENTS:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
 5+ years of experience in a similar role
 Strong understanding of AWS and Azure cloud platforms
 Proficiency in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell)
 Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation, ARM templates)
 Familiarity with CI/CD tools and practices (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps)
 Experience with configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
 Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills
 Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus
 Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking ?Apply Today? you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

body.title:
Quality Analyst (Automation)
Quality Analyst (Automation)
body.description:
About the job
Sapiens is on the lookout for a Quality Analyst(Automation) to become a key player in our Bangalore team. If you're a seasoned QA pro and ready to take your career to new heights with an established, globally successful company, this role could be the perfect fit.

Location: Bangalore

 Working Model: Our flexible work arrangement combines both remote and in-office work, optimizing flexibility and productivity.

This position will be part of Sapiens Digital division, for more information about it, click here: https://sapiens.com/solutions/digitalsuite-customer-experience-and-engagement-software-for-insurers/

What You‚Äôll Do

 As part of the Sapiens Digitalsuite delivery team, you will be testing a complex, highly available, flexible, extensible, multi-tier, scalable, high performance & reliable applications and maintains its high level of quality. 
 Review and analyze system specifications 
 Design/Execute test cases (manual or automated) and analyze results 
 Evaluate product code according to specifications 
 Create logs to document testing phases and defects 
 Report bugs and errors to development teams 
 Help troubleshoot issues with strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
 Conduct post-release/ post-implementation testing 
 Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle. 

Must Have Skills.

What to Have for this position.

 Proven experience as QA tester or similar role with 3.5+ years relevant experience. 
 Experienced with test case creation and execution to cover Functional, Regression, Integration and E2E testing. 
 Familiarity with Agile frameworks and regression testing. 
 Ability to document and troubleshoot errors 
 Working knowledge of test management software (e.g. qTest, QC) and SQL 
 Excellent communication skills 
 Analytical mind and problem-solving aptitude 
 Insurance domain knowledge - preferred 

About Sapiens

Sapiens is a global leader in the insurance industry, delivering its award-winning, cloud-based SaaS insurance platform‚ÄØto over 600 customers in more than 30 countries. Sapiens‚Äô platform offers pre-integrated, low-code capabilities to accelerate customers‚Äô digital transformation. With more than 40 years of industry expertise, Sapiens has a highly professional team of over 5,000 employees globally. For More information visit us on www.sapiens.com.

Sapiens is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment that embraces individuals from diverse backgrounds.

Disclaimer : Sapiens India does not authorise any third parties to release employment offers or conduct recruitment drives via a third party. Hence, beware of inauthentic and fraudulent job offers or recruitment drives from any individuals or websites purporting to represent Sapiens . Further, Sapiens does not charge any fee or other emoluments for any reason (including without limitation, visa fees) or seek compensation from educational institutions to participate in recruitment events. Accordingly, please check the authenticity of any such offers before acting on them and where acted upon, you do so at your own risk. Sapiens shall neither be responsible for honouring or making good the promises made by fraudulent third parties, nor for any monetary or any other loss incurred by the aggrieved individual or educational institution. In the event that you come across any fraudulent activities in the name of Sapiens , please feel free report the incident at sapiens to sharedservices@sapiens.com.

body.title:
SAP Project Manager ‚Äì Automation
SAP Project Manager ‚Äì Automation with verification
body.description:
About the job
If you enjoy working with high-caliber people on interesting projects in a thriving partnership organization, Westernacher is the place to be!

To complement our team in the United States, we are looking for SAP Project Manager - Automation

Location: Remote (United States)

Your Responsibilities

Lead and manage SAP automation projects from initiation to completion, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and strategies for SAP automation initiatives, ensuring timely and efficient delivery.
Collaborate with stakeholders, including business units and IT teams, to define project scope, objectives, and expectations for automation within the SAP environment.
Oversee the selection, implementation, and integration of automation tools specific to SAP (e.g., Robotic Process Automation (RPA), SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (IRPA)).
Manage resources, budgets, and schedules to ensure that SAP automation projects are delivered within scope and financial constraints.
Ensure the quality and compliance of automation solutions within the SAP ecosystem, ensuring minimal disruption to existing processes.
Oversee testing and validation of automation solutions within SAP, ensuring they meet business requirements and performance standards.
Ensure SAP automation projects follow SAP best practices, methodologies, and industry standards.

Your Skills And Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred).
Proven experience managing SAP automation projects, with in-depth knowledge of SAP modules (e.g., SAP S/4HANA, SAP ERP, SAP Ariba, etc.).
Strong experience with Robotic Process Automation tools, particularly SAP specific tools such as SAP Intelligent RPA or third-party RPA tools like UiPath, Automation Anywhere, and Blue Prism.
Strong understanding of SAP workflows and processes, including finance,procurement, HR, and supply chain.
Proficiency with SAP project management tools and methodologies (e.g., SAP Activate, Agile, Waterfall).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify issues and implement effective solutions in SAP automation projects.
Knowledge of SAP architecture, cloud solutions, and integration with other business systems.
Industry-specific experience (e.g., manufacturing, retail, finance) with SAP is advantageous.

What We Offer

Career advancement opportunities as we grow our S/4HANA Cloud practice in the Americas.
Competitive remuneration package (salary, bonus, social benefits).
A balanced mix of onsite and remote project work.
Opportunities to work on innovative public cloud projects across various industries.
A friendly, supportive team environment with a culture of trust, open communication, and regular feedback.
Minimal hierarchy, with quick and effective decision-making processes.

Interested? Then, don't hesitate to apply!

This Is WE

Committed to innovation since 1969, Westernacher Consulting operates worldwide, with more than 1200 consultants in Europe, Asia and the Americas. We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large-sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence, and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation.

Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

To be eligible for this position, candidates must be a US Citizen or US Permanent Resident. No Sponsorship or Visas are available at this time.

body.title:
QA Automation
QA Automation
body.description:
About the job
About The Job QA Automation

Job brief

The ideal candidate will review the requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback to clients.

Responsibilities

Create detailed, comprehensive and well structured test plans and test cases.
Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities.
Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open-source tools.
Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs.
Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved.
Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs.
Liaise with internal teams (e.g., developers and product managers) to identify system requirements.
Monitor debugging process results.
Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions.
Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts.
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies.


Requirements

Minimum Bachelors Degree in Software Development/Engineering.
Proven work experience in software development.
Proven work experience in software quality assurance.
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes.
Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing.
Hands-on experience with automated testing tools.
Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus.

Location: San Rafael, CA (100% REMOTE)

The SAP OTC Test Lead will be responsible to play as test lead for SAP OTC (Order to Cash) track.

Execution of test cases, defect management, and adherence to test schedule
Create Master and Transaction data for testing needed by other team members
May coordinate onshore and offshore testing
Responsible for UAT support and testing production defect fixes
Attend any meetings as required to execute the project, provide status updates or demo functionality to stakeholders
Provides weekly QA project status reports
Working in Agile Testing environment
Integrate effectively with scrum teams

Qualifications:
Must have 6 to 9 years of extensive experience in UFT Automation
Must have strong experience in VB Script String experience in various automation frameworks like Hybrid, Keyword driven, BPT, etc.
Experience with large SAP implementation/upgrade project
Broad knowledge of SAP ERP modules
Minimum 8+ years of IT and business work experience with broad exposure to various technical environments and business segments
5+ years of SAP SD Functional experience
5+ years of manual testing experience
2+ years of experience in SAP S4HANA and SAP FIORI
Knowledge of security testing is plus
Experience with multi country support of SAP ECC / S4HANA
Demonstrated ability to balance competing requirements and interests, keep focused on top priorities, and find ways to achieve win-win or obtain acceptance/consensus for best compromise
Problem solving skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Exhibits accountability and accepts responsibility and consequences for work performance and conduct
Experience in automating third party applications, tools and interfaces integrated with SAP
Experience in automation SAP Business Processes is must
Hands on experience in JIRA and Confluence Experience in Agile Methodology is must

body.title:
Intelligent Automation Manager
Intelligent Automation Manager with verification
body.description:
About the job
Our client, a leader in the automation industry, is seeking an Intelligent Automation Manager to join their team. As a Intelligent Automation Manager, you will be part of the development department managing and supporting a team of automation developers. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, exceptional problem-solving abilities, and excellent communication skills which will align successfully in the organization.

Job Title: Intelligent Automation Manager

Location: Oshkosh, Wisconsin (Hybrid - 3 days in the office)

Pay Range: Competitive salary based on experience

What's the Job?

Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of Intelligent Automation Developers to achieve high-quality results. 
Serve as a subject matter expert in UiPath and Microsoft Power Platform, guiding best practices and implementation. 
Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of automation projects, ensuring timely and successful delivery. 


What's Needed?

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (Master‚Äôs preferred). 
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Intelligent Automation development with expertise in UiPath and Microsoft Power Platform. 
Proven experience leading and managing development teams, including project planning and resource allocation. 


If this is a role that interests you and you'd like to learn more, click apply now and a recruiter will be in touch with you to discuss this great opportunity. We look forward to speaking with you!

 About ManpowerGroup, Parent Company of: Manpower, Experis, Talent Solutions, and Jefferson Wells 

ManpowerGroup¬Æ (NYSE: MAN), the leading global workforce solutions company, helps organizations transform in a fast-changing world of work by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to win. We develop innovative solutions for hundreds of thousands of organizations every year, providing them with skilled talent while finding meaningful, sustainable employment for millions of people across a wide range of industries and skills. Our expert family of brands ‚Äì Manpower, Experis, Talent Solutions, and Jefferson Wells ‚Äì creates substantial value for candidates and clients across more than 75 countries and territories and has done so for over 70 years. We are recognized consistently for our diversity - as a best place to work for Women, Inclusion, Equality and Disability and in 2023 ManpowerGroup was named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the 14th year - all confirming our position as the brand of choice for in-demand talent.

About the job
Haldren is looking for a Remote Marketing Automation Manager to join our team. This pivotal role involves overseeing and optimizing our marketing automation platforms to enhance our marketing strategies and customer engagement efforts. The ideal candidate will be passionate about leveraging technology for marketing growth and efficiency.

To learn more about the company, please visit Haldren's website:

https://www.haldren.com/

As a fully remote position, this role allows flexibility and the ability to communicate with cross-functional teams globally.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and manage marketing automation strategies that drive engagement, nurture leads, and improve customer experience
Utilize marketing automation tools (such as HubSpot, Marketo, or Pardot) to create and implement automated workflows, email campaigns, and customer journeys
Analyze and report on key performance metrics, providing insights to enhance campaign performance and optimize marketing tactics
Collaborate with content, design, and technical teams to ensure effective integration and execution of marketing automation strategies
Monitor technology trends and best practices in marketing automation to continually enhance our strategies
Train and support team members on using marketing tools and best practices


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
3-5 years of experience in marketing automation, preferably in a managerial role
Proficiency in marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot)
Strong understanding of digital marketing principles and funnel optimization
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, to collaborate effectively with teams
Self-motivated with a strong ability to manage multiple projects in a remote setting

Full-Time Position
Permanent Employment Opportunity

Generous Commissions on Filled Positions

Paid Leaves for Annual leave, Sick Days, and Paid Holidays

body.title:
Quality & Process Automation Engineer - Lead
Quality & Process Automation Engineer - Lead with verification
body.description:
About the job
Quality & Process Automation Engineer-Lead
Remote 

Job Summary
‚ÄúThis Job Matters‚Äù
What‚Äôs the job?
The Multi-Site Quality & Process Automation Engineer is a direct report of the Siding Products Group Quality & Process Control Director and is a member of Staff. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the design, implementation, and optimization of automation systems in vinyl siding manufacturing. This includes working closely with cross-functional teams to enhance production efficiency, ensure safety, improve quality, and reduce downtime by automating key processes and improving data collection and analysis. The role involves evaluating, troubleshooting, installing, testing and maintaining automation systems, as well as training on new equipment and systems.
Essential Functions:
Automate Inspections:
Create and set up automated systems using vision systems and robotics for inspecting vinyl siding production.
Develop software to spot defects like color issues, surface defects, and dimensional inconsistencies.
Integrate these systems with current production equipment and ensure they provide instant feedback to reduce defects.
Optimize Processes & Ensure Quality:
Collaborate with the Quality & Process Control team to define critical quality metrics and choose systems to measure them.
Analyze inspection data to find trends, reduce defects, and make improvements.
Enhance the accuracy and efficiency of inspection systems to reduce errors and increase productivity.
Create and apply procedures for inline quality inspection.
Monitor & Analyze Processes:
Implement and maintain Statistical Process Control (SPC) methods.
Examine process data to spot trends and quality issues.
Monitor key process parameters and ensure they stay within set limits.
Use SPC tools to analyze data and identify areas for improvement.
System Integration & Maintenance:
Connect inspection systems with plant control systems like PLCs and SCADA & Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
Troubleshoot and maintain inspection equipment, including vision systems and sensors, to keep them working reliably.
Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:
Collaborate with engineering, quality, and production teams to enhance processes based on inspection data.
Train staff on using inspection equipment and interpreting data.
Lead efforts to improve inspection speed and accuracy while reducing the need for manual checks.

Qualifications 
‚ÄúYour Skills Matter‚Äù
What do you bring?
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree: Engineering, Manufacturing/Industrial Engineering, or other technical field: Required
WCM, project Management or Six Sigma Green Belt Certified: Preferred
Practical/Technical/Digital Knowledge
5+ years of experience in automation engineering, Industry 4.0 preferably within the manufacturing.
Experience with statistical process control (SPC).
Experience in designing and implementing automated inspection systems, Industry 4.0 particularly in vinyl or plastic manufacturing.
Proficiency with machine vision systems, cameras, and sensor integration (e.g., Cognex, Keyence, or similar platforms).
Familiarity with PLC programming (Siemens, Allen-Bradley) and HMI systems.
Experience with connecting with Manufacturing Execution System (MES)

Quality & Safety Expectations
Know and understand the safety and quality policies.
Complete all safety and quality training required for the specific position.
Follow all safety and quality rules and procedures and remind others.
Commit to addressing and reporting any unsafe condition or quality issue immediately.
Be empowered to speak up when unsafe behaviors are observed or quality issues arise and to not place blame while investigating these issues.
Adhere to the principles of data integrity.

Pay Transparency
‚ÄúAdditional Requirements‚Äù
Certain states require pay information be provided in job postings. The national pay range for this position is $99,900 to $154,800 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors.
In addition to base salary, this position is eligible for an annual bonus. The targeted bonus amount is 13% of base salary based on company and individual performance measures. The total target cash range (base pay and annual bonus) for this position, is $112,887.00 to $174,924.00
Our Benefits
‚ÄúYou Matter to Us‚Äù
What are our perks?
Employees have the flexibility to choose the benefits that best fit their individual needs.
Health and Wellbeing ‚Äì Supporting your wellbeing, to thrive in life and work.
Medical, Prescription Drug, Vision, and Dental Insurance
Healthcare Saving Account and Flexible Spending Account options
LiveWell Wellness Program
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Paid Time Off and Paid Parental Leave
Retirement and Protection - Helping to make the future life you want a reality.
401(k) with Company Match, Retirement Accumulation Plan (RAP) Cash Balance Pension Plan
Company-provided Life Insurance, AD&D, Short-Term Disability
Voluntary employee and dependent life insurance, Long-Term Disability, Critical Illness and Accident Insurance
Additional Benefits ‚Äì Helping shape the experience and impact you want.
Commuter Benefits
Group Legal
Identity Theft Protection
Auto and Home Insurance
Pet Insurance and Discounts
Back-up Child and Elder Care
PerkSpot Employee Discount Program
Volunteer Day

body.title:

UiPath Automation Engineer with verification
body.description:
About the job
Job Summary

 JOB DESCRIPTION 

This position will work with cutting edge technology, deliver high quality solutions across various industries, and collaborate with teams on engagements that range in size and scope. This role will assess business processes and identify areas of application for RPA technologies, as well as architect, design, develop, and deploy software robots, or bots, to work alongside humans to enhance business process efficiency. This position will receive continuous career development opportunities, given the size and potential of client engagements. This role will perform hands-on delivery of data analytics projects with focus on process automation, contributing to the development and unit testing of solutions.

Job Duties

Designs, and implements best in class automation (RPA) solutions, data ingestion strategies, data warehouse and data mart structures, semantic layers and models, visualizations, streaming processes, and API integrations for end-to-end data analytics solutions on primarily, but not limited to, cloud analytics platforms such as Azure and AWS
Listens to client needs to align solution with business requirements and delivery schedule
Creates written functional and technical designs
Participates in project status and stand meetings, and assists with providing aggregated project status for project and program managers
Assists with SLA compliance of solutions, and performs performance tuning and optimization efforts of end-to-end solutions
Prepares solution design documents and develops framework for automating scripting-based processes
Creates reusable workflows and library components to reduce the development time and increase maintainability 
Delivers high-performance, scalable, repeatable, and secure deliverables with broad impact (high throughput and low latency)
Assists with implementation of governance programs and best practices
Performs the cleaning and transforming of data from source systems into analytics models
Implements models to support data visualizations and integrations is preferred
Assists with implementing DevOps, DataOps and MLOps methodologies on projects
Assists project managers with work breakdown structure creation, project estimation, resource staffing, workload planning and adjustments throughout the project lifecycle
Assists clients with licensing, security, and cost estimation of solutions
Performs code reviews to ensure adherence to standards
Works directly with clients and team members to establish secure data analytics platforms and infrastructure 
Contributes to successful deployments of developed solutions and integration of DevOps tools
Maintains a broad and current understanding of process automation, data analytics and business intelligence strategies, cloud platforms, methodologies, and tools
Builds client relationships during project execution, effectively becoming a trusted advisor of the client
Participates in support activities for existing software solutions
Other duties as assigned


Supervisory Responsibilities

Supervises the day-to-day workload of Associates on assigned engagements to ensure that timelines and deliverables are met, and reviews work product


Education

Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

High School Diploma or GED equivalent, required
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferred; focus in Information Systems, Data Science or Computer Science, preferred


Experience

Five (5) or more years of experience within Process Automation, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, required
One (1) or more years of experience technically leading development projects, preferred
One (1) or more years of consulting experience or implementation of cloud-based data analytics solutions, preferred
One (1) or more years of experience with RPA, automation, Power Automate, or UiPath Development, preferred 
Hands-on work-related experience in designing, delivering, and managing automation solutions, preferred


License/Certifications

UiPath certified developer, preferred
Power Automate certified developer, preferred
Azure Fundamentals, preferred


Software

Experience with two (2) or more of the following, required:
UiPath Platform
Studio
Orchestrator
Microsoft Power Platform
Power Automate
Power Apps
AI Builder 
Automation Anywhere 
Blue Prism
Alteryx
Experience with .NET development tools 
Experience with other non-Microsoft development languages or tools 
Strong SQL skills including Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), views, functions, stored procedures, or performance tuning, required
Experience with one (1) or more of the following computer languages, required:
C#
VB
Java
Python
Experience with Data Warehousing, Data Modeling, Semantic Model Definition or Star Schema Construction, preferred
Hands on delivery experience of end-to-end cloud data analytics solutions within Azure or AWS, preferred
Experience with Git and DevOps deployment technologies, preferred
Experience with Linux, preferred
Experience with one (1) or more of the following, preferred:
AI Algorithms/Machine Learning
IoT and/or streaming data ingestion tools
Computer Vision based AI technologies
Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Ability to work with a high degree of professionalism and autonomy
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Solid organizational skills, especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details
Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment
Ability to work in a deadline-driven environment, and handle multiple projects simultaneously 
Ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels of the Firm
Ability to effectively interact with a team of professionals and delegating work assignments, as needed
Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel 
Ability to encourage a team environment on engagements, and contribute to the professional development of assigned personnel


Keywords: Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, BI, Solution Architect, Data Architect, Synapse, IoT, Machine Learning, Data Lake, Microsoft, SQL Server, .Net, C#, Power BI, Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory, RedShift, UiPath, Cloud, RPA, AWS, Redshift, Python, Data Modeling, SQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power Automate, Power Platform, AI Builder, Power Apps, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UiPath Studio, Orchestrator, ERP, QuickBooks, SAP, NetSuite, Oracle, API, JSON, XML, Web Services, SOAP, Postman, Fiddler, Integration, Custom Activities, DLL, Insight, Automation Hub, Task Capture

Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate‚Äôs qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.

California Range: $80,000 - $122,000

Colorado Range: $80,000 - $122,000

Illinois Range: $80,000 - $122,000

Washington DC Range: $80,000 - $122,000

About Us

Join us at BDO, where you will find more than a career, you‚Äôll find a place where your work is impactful, and you are valued for your individuality. We offer flexibility and opportunities for advancement. Our culture is centered around making meaningful connections, approaching interactions with curiosity, and being true to yourself, all while making a positive difference in the world.

At BDO, our purpose of helping people thrive every day is at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are focused on delivering exceptional and sustainable outcomes and value for our people, our clients, and our communities. BDO is proud to be an ESOP company, reflecting a culture that puts people first, by sharing financially in our growth in value with our U.S. team. BDO professionals provide assurance, tax and advisory services for a diverse range of clients across the U.S. and in over 160 countries through our global organization.

BDO is the first large accounting and advisory organization to implement an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). A qualified retirement plan, the ESOP offers participants a stake in the firm‚Äôs success through beneficial ownership and a unique opportunity to enhance their financial well-being. The ESOP stands as a compelling addition to our comprehensive compensation and Total Rewards benefits* offerings. The annual allocation to the ESOP is fully funded by BDO through investments in company stock and grants employees the chance to grow their wealth over time as their shares vest and grow in value with the firm‚Äôs success, with no employee contributions.

We Are Committed To Delivering Exceptional Experiences To Middle Market Leaders By Sharing Insight-driven Perspectives, Helping Companies Take Business As Usual To Better Than Usual. With Industry Knowledge And Experience, a Breadth And Depth Of Resources, And Unwavering Commitment To Quality, We Pride Ourselves On

Welcoming diverse perspectives and understanding the experience of our professionals and clients
Empowering team members to explore their full potential
Our talented team who brings varying skills, knowledge and experience to proactively help our clients navigate an expanding array of complex challenges and opportunities
Celebrating ingenuity and innovation to transform our business and help our clients transform theirs
Focus on resilience and sustainability to positively impact our people, clients, and communities
BDO Total Rewards that encompass so much more than traditional ‚Äúbenefits.‚Äù Click here to find out more!

body.title:
SAP Project Manager ‚Äì Automation
SAP Project Manager ‚Äì Automation with verification
body.description:
About the job
If you enjoy working with high-caliber people on interesting projects in a thriving partnership organization, Westernacher is the place to be!

To complement our team in the United States, we are looking for SAP Project Manager - Automation

Location: Remote (United States)

Your Responsibilities

Lead and manage SAP automation projects from initiation to completion, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and strategies for SAP automation initiatives, ensuring timely and efficient delivery.
Collaborate with stakeholders, including business units and IT teams, to define project scope, objectives, and expectations for automation within the SAP environment.
Oversee the selection, implementation, and integration of automation tools specific to SAP (e.g., Robotic Process Automation (RPA), SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (IRPA)).
Manage resources, budgets, and schedules to ensure that SAP automation projects are delivered within scope and financial constraints.
Ensure the quality and compliance of automation solutions within the SAP ecosystem, ensuring minimal disruption to existing processes.
Oversee testing and validation of automation solutions within SAP, ensuring they meet business requirements and performance standards.
Ensure SAP automation projects follow SAP best practices, methodologies, and industry standards.

Your Skills And Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred).
Proven experience managing SAP automation projects, with in-depth knowledge of SAP modules (e.g., SAP S/4HANA, SAP ERP, SAP Ariba, etc.).
Strong experience with Robotic Process Automation tools, particularly SAP specific tools such as SAP Intelligent RPA or third-party RPA tools like UiPath, Automation Anywhere, and Blue Prism.
Strong understanding of SAP workflows and processes, including finance,procurement, HR, and supply chain.
Proficiency with SAP project management tools and methodologies (e.g., SAP Activate, Agile, Waterfall).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify issues and implement effective solutions in SAP automation projects.
Knowledge of SAP architecture, cloud solutions, and integration with other business systems.
Industry-specific experience (e.g., manufacturing, retail, finance) with SAP is advantageous.

What We Offer

Career advancement opportunities as we grow our S/4HANA Cloud practice in the Americas.
Competitive remuneration package (salary, bonus, social benefits).
A balanced mix of onsite and remote project work.
Opportunities to work on innovative public cloud projects across various industries.
A friendly, supportive team environment with a culture of trust, open communication, and regular feedback.
Minimal hierarchy, with quick and effective decision-making processes.

Interested? Then, don't hesitate to apply!

This Is WE

Committed to innovation since 1969, Westernacher Consulting operates worldwide, with more than 1200 consultants in Europe, Asia and the Americas. We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large-sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence, and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation.

Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

To be eligible for this position, candidates must be a US Citizen or US Permanent Resident. No Sponsorship or Visas are available at this time.

body.title:

Quality Assurance Automation Engineer with verification
body.description:
About the job
Job Summary: As a Software Engineer in Test, you will be responsible for developing and implementing new testing tools and paradigms for managing the testing of microservices interacting with Java-based applications. You will work independently across the entire build and deploy pipeline, ensuring the quality and reliability of our applications through comprehensive testing strategies, including unit, integration, regression, and more.

Key Responsibilities:
Tool and Paradigm Development:
Design and develop new testing tools and frameworks tailored to our microservices architecture and Java-based applications.
Innovate and implement new paradigms for effective and efficient testing processes.
Build and Deploy Pipeline:
Integrate testing processes seamlessly into the CI/CD pipeline.
Ensure that testing tools and frameworks support the automation of build, test, and deployment processes.
Testing Strategy:
Develop and maintain comprehensive testing strategies covering all test types, including unit, integration, regression, performance, and more.
Ensure thorough testing of microservices and their interactions with Java applications.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct rigorous testing to identify and address defects early in the development process.
Implement best practices for test planning and test case management, defect tracking, and reporting.
Collaboration and Mentorship:
Work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to ensure quality throughout the development lifecycle.
Provide mentorship and guidance to other test engineers and developers on testing best practices.
Problem Solving:
Identify, analyze, and resolve complex testing issues creatively and effectively.
Exercise good judgment in solving day-to-day testing challenges independently.

Your Qualifications & Skills:
BS/MS in computer science, engineering or equivalent
Experience in software testing and quality assurance, particularly with Java-based applications and microservices architectures.
Proven ability to design and implement new testing tools and frameworks.
Strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and their integration with testing processes.
Expertise in a variety of test types, including unit, integration, regression, performance, and more.
Proficiency in testing automation tools and frameworks.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to addressing testing challenges.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively across teams.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Office and company language is English.

The exchange team develops and maintain a cutting-edge trading platform. With a global presence across APAC, EMEA and North America, the team has since grown with the goal to provide a seamless and secure trading experience for our clients.

Job Responsibilities
Develop and execute test plans and test cases with a strong emphasis on using code to solve technical challenges and shorten the test cycle through automation. 
Estimate test efforts, analyse and communicate test results and participate in day to day QA Activities. 
Develop/Maintain and improve the test frameworks, tools and technologies used by the organization to maintain a high quality bar. 
Work with Development, Test and Product Management to design and implement test and validation strategies. 
Execute and manage test cases and results, report on test and defect metrics. 
Create, execute and troubleshoot automated test scenarios across our systems. 
Contribute to robust, scalable, and high quality test automation solutions for functional, regression and performance testing 
Contribute to the building of a Continuous Integration (CI) environment and ongoing process improvement activities. 
Identify required improvements in the test and development processes; make contributions to our automation tools that address specific needs. 
Maintain a high quality bar in a complex and constantly evolving workspace.

Experience in Backend server system QA, and preferably Algo trading 
QA Experience with mobile and web testing is a plus and automated test techniques with a strong focus on quality throughout the entire software development cycle. 
Experience in working with different frameworks like TestNG, Appium, Selenium, Cucumber etc.

Design and development skills in Java and/or Python. 
Understanding of software design principles, patterns, algorithms, data structures and multi-threading concepts.

Strong customer focus, excellent problem solving and analytical skills.

Experience working in an agile environment preferred.

Passion for improving code quality through interaction with development team.

Life @ Crypto.com
Empowered to think big. Try new opportunities while working with a talented, ambitious and supportive team.
Transformational and proactive working environment. Empower employees to find thoughtful and innovative solutions.
Growth from within. We help to develop new skill-sets that would impact the shaping of your personal and professional growth.

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we‚Äôre helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. Title And Summary

body.title:
Vice President, Software Development, Automation, Material Handling
Vice President, Software Development, Automation, Material Handling
body.description:
About the job
This is a remote position.

Vice President, Software Development, Automation, Material Handling

Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States full-time. We are not able to sponsor applicants for work visas at this time.

About us: We are backed by a recent $3.8 million investment from top silicon valley investors, we're on a mission to unlock the full potential of developers.

What We Do: Patterned Learning AI platform helps developers learn, grow, and excel by providing intelligent code assistance, identifying areas for improvement, and fostering a collaborative learning environment.

We have a flexible, work-from-home friendly, style of operation with an on site office that is optional.

Benefits: We offer health benefits and generous PTO packages.

Our office is dog friendly, has unlimited snacks & drinks, flexible working hours (get out for the pow day!), and lots of rock climbing & skateboarding.

We also offer competitive healthcare benefits and a 401k program.

At Patterned Learning AI, we are committed to being a fun, groundbreaking, and inclusive place to work. We strongly encourage engineers from all community and traditionally underrepresented backgrounds to apply

The Position

The company is seeking an accomplished and dynamic Vice President, Product Development to be a part of the company‚Äôs executive leadership team. Reporting directly to the Chief Executive Officer, this role will oversee a team of 40+ development personnel through five managers. The Vice President, Product Development will lead new product architecture and drive cutting edge engineering and product development to bring a new generation of Material Handling solutions.

The Vice President, Product Development will need to lead and manage new software and development processes, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. The Vice President will provide executive leadership, development and direction over software engineering, testing, deployment and support teams.

Principal Responsibilities & Duties:

Control and create definition of the system architecture and implementation processes for delivering world class solutions to clients.

Work directly with sales and clients to jointly create ‚Äúneeds based‚Äù functional requirements/specifications to promote further interest in company solutions.

Provide necessary implementation structure and processes to allow for scalability of delivery capabilities through use management of outsourced and junior development engineers.

Manage, monitor, and control the delivery of on-time projects through appropriate allocation of resources.

Work to create greater vision and visibility of the product to customers, prospective customers, and various adjacent senior management groups within the organization.

Align the company‚Äôs business growth strategy with employees, clients and vendors.

Oversee and direct the software engineering processes including functional and design specification, prototyping, review, development, testing, QA, internal and external documentation, implementation, 24/7/365 support and patch/upgrade/release management.

Introduce new technologies, tools and education, ensuring the company remains a competitive and compelling organization.

Supervise and create enhanced accountability of Software team members.

Direct R&D efforts for future state of software and introduce new functionalities.

Enhance client‚Äôs user experience through improvement of UIs (client, server, web, mobile).

Assist in analyzing potential ‚ÄúPartnering‚Äù companies who have synergistic products that could add significant value to product offerings.

Travel As Required To Fulfill Responsibilities.

The Candidate

The company is looking for a proven Vice President, Product Development capable of delivering cutting edge, next generation material handling software solutions. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership and technical skills, with a background of proven products that have successfully entered the market. The successful candidate will have the ability to develop strong relationships and collaborate well with various teams including: sales, operations and finance.

The ideal candidate will have proven experience with software architecture and engineering management. The Vice President will not be hands-on, but needs to be a mentor and coach to lead the development team. The successful candidate will have demonstrated expertise in material handling systems and automation software. The Vice President must have strong leadership skills and the ability to drive innovation and product development. S/he will need to have effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex information and key concepts adapted for audiences, including but not limited to the Corporate Executive Team and Board of Directors.

The individual we are seeking must have previous experience in software product development life cycle, technical prowess of modern software architecture, and significant leadership experience with development, quality and deployment teams for ‚Äúmission critical‚Äù software products used by customers.

Summary of Requirements:

 Bachelor‚Äôs degree required. Master‚Äôs is preferred. 
 Minimum 10 years‚Äô experience in senior management position(s) responsible for the delivery of client-based software solutions with a preference for operational process improvement and/or controls-based software. 
 Progressive professional growth through various software development and leadership positions. 
 Demonstrated ability to grow and scale software development and deployment teams. 
 Have a thorough understanding of Service Orientated Architecture (SOA), distributed process-based systems, Windows and Linux operating systems, and associated programming languages. 
 Experience with Python, Azure, Kubernetes, cloud-based systems also a plus. 
 Have a strong desire to build a dynamic team environment. 
 Expertise in growing internal software development and deployment teams for scalability. 
 Microsoft competencies a plus.

body.description:
About the job
Job Description

Are you interested in people and innovative automation technologies? Do you have experience in working with complex stakeholders and business process automation? Are you looking to join a team that values diversity and collaboration? If so, we would like to have you on board!

The Intelligent Automation Tribe, part of Technology & Services under the BWOW structure at Danske Bank, focuses on democratising and delivering intelligent and tactical automation solutions. These solutions help improve the bank‚Äôs cost efficiency, quality, compliance, and delivery speed, serving the needs of the entire organisation.

We are proud of our inclusive automation culture at Danske Bank. Our Intelligent Automation Tribe is focused on enabling the organisation to leverage benefits while awaiting strategic systems or complete process transformation. We focus on the development and maintenance of both new and existing intelligent automation solutions, drawing on industry best practices, innovations, and standards.

Our team is composed of 60 skilled professionals with diverse backgrounds and skills in automation technologies, including IT Software Engineers, Business Analysts, and IT Platform Engineers. We are an international team with members located in both Lithuania and India, and we welcome applicants from all walks of life to join us.

In Intelligent Automation tribe your role will be called Developement Partner.

"Everyone is welcome ‚Äì bring your authentic and full self to work."

You will:

Have a HR responsibility of team with IT Software Engineers skillset and Business Analysts
Create a conductive and collaborative environment through effective leadership
Establish the close collaboration with Tribes and service organizations within Technology & Service and Business Units in the bank to secure their engagement and support deliverables
Build the understanding of the business, process areas and their needs; being a challenger in bringing the intelligent automation leaver in their backlogs
Work in agile set-up to achieve the best possible outcome balancing duration, cost and objectives
Be an ambassador of Intelligent automation in Danske Bank

About you:

Great interest in IT and automation fields with a proactive constant search for new options and ways how to drive automation agenda in the organization, Experience in data analysis and familiarity with Atlassian tools (JIRA/Confluence) would be helpful
Proven experience working with business stakeholders within a cross-functional matrix environment, with great communication, facilitation and stakeholder management skills
Demonstrate decisiveness in resolving business problems, making decisions and identifying priorities
Comfortable with a changing environment and curious about engaging in a large and complex organization where you where you can show your proactivity and commitment
A collaborative mind-set and a genuine intention to develop the skills within your team
Experience in a similar role within a global organisation or a large consultancy, with an interest or background in IT, with 2-3 years of experience in a leadership position
Advanced English language skills

We offer:

Monthly salary range from 3920 EUR to 5880 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:

Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits  HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Leader of team.

Please contact if you have any questions.

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

body.description:
About the job
About Us

Automation Anywhere is a leader in AI-powered process automation that puts AI to work across organizations. The company‚Äôs Automation Success Platform is powered with specialized AI, generative AI and offers process discovery, RPA, end-to-end process orchestration, document processing, and analytics, with a security and governance-first approach. Automation Anywhere empowers organizations worldwide to unleash productivity gains, drive innovation, improve customer service and accelerate business growth. The company is guided by its vision to fuel the future of work by unleashing human potential through AI-powered automation. Learn more at www.automationanywhere.com

Our Opportunity

Our AI Agent Studio provides a secure, enterprise-ready platform that seamlessly integrates Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with advanced AI technologies. Built natively within the A360 platform, it offers the scalability and resilience enterprises demand. With advancements in Generative AI (GenAI), we‚Äôre unlocking new potential by enabling semi-autonomous agents to plan, execute tools, and collaborate with humans effectively. As we continue to innovate, we‚Äôre looking for a passionate UI engineer to join us on this exciting journey.

As a Senior Staff Engineer, you will take the lead in designing and developing all UI-related features for our AI Agent Studio. Leveraging cutting-edge and high-performing technologies, you will drive quality in design, development, and documentation while fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth among the development team. Join us to shape the future of intelligent automation!

Who You‚Äôll Report To

This role reports to our Director, Engineering

Location:

San Jose, CA Bay area preferred ‚Äì other U.S locations considered

You Will Make An Impact By Being Responsible For

Design and Development: Developing and maintaining high-quality, scalable, and performance-oriented UI components and features using modern front-end technologies like React. Focusing on consistent delivery of software and systems that move the company towards achieving short and long-term objectives
Collaboration: Working closely with Product Management, UX, Backend Engineers, SDET and Support organizations to deliver industry-leading features to the market. Translate requirements into technical solutions and seamless user experiences
Code Quality: Writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code, adhering to best practices in UI development. Conduct code reviews to ensure quality and consistency
Innovation: Driving the adoption of new tools, frameworks, and methodologies to enhance development efficiency and UI performance
Scalability and Performance: Optimizing UI components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
Accessibility and Standards: Ensuring the UI complies with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and adheres to company design guidelines
Mentorship: Providing technical mentorship to junior engineers and share knowledge across teams to foster a culture of learning and improvement

You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have

10+ years of professional experience in front-end/UI development, with a strong portfolio of work
Deep Understanding of Web UI, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS
Deep understanding of React
Strong understanding of the E2E request/response cycle between client and server (HTTP, Server side, browser internals) for delivering blazing-fast, high-performance applications
Good knowledge in CSS
Good understanding of ECMAScript and TypeScript
Experience with build tools like Webpack and testing frameworks like Jest, Cypress
Cross-browser scalability & compatibility in multiple browsers like Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Apple Safari and Mozilla Firefox
Ability to build responsive, and accessibility-compliant applications (i.e. WCAG)
Bonus Skills:
Experience with RPA platforms or automation tools
Experience evaluating and implementing component libraries
Familiarity with backend technologies
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes
You Excel In These Key Competencies

Collaboration and Teamwork - The role requires close interaction with Product Management, UX, Backend Engineers, SDET, and Support teams. Strong collaboration skills are essential for aligning efforts across teams and ensuring seamless execution
Problem-Solving and Analytical Thinking - Developing scalable, high-performance UI components and optimizing user experiences demand a sharp analytical mindset to address technical challenges and craft innovative solutions
Communication Skills - The ability to articulate technical concepts effectively and translate requirements into actionable solutions is critical for collaboration with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Adaptability and Continuous Learning - The role involves adopting new tools, frameworks, and methodologies, as well as mentoring others. A growth mindset and willingness to adapt to evolving technologies and practices are vital
Attention to Detail - Ensuring compliance with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG), maintaining consistent code quality, and delivering polished user experiences require meticulous attention to detail

The base salary range for this position in California, New York, and Washington is $215,000 ‚Äì $230,000 and outside of those locations is $205,000 ‚Äì 220,000 a year. The base salary ultimately offered is determined through a review of education, industry experience, training, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant in alignment with market data and other factors. This position is also eligible for a discretionary bonus, equity and a full range of medical and other benefits.

Ready to Revolutionize Work? Join Us.

This is an opportunity to work with a global, passionate team pioneering technology that‚Äôs redefining the way people work, everywhere. Join us and discover the many ways that you can have an impact, achieve your potential, and go be great.

Job Segment OR Key Words: Front End, Web UI, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS, React

#JS1

Benefits And Perks You‚Äôll Appreciate

Flexible work schedule / remote roles
Unlimited Personal Time Off
12 holidays off per year
4 days volunteer time off per year
4 company ‚ÄúAchievement‚Äù days off per year
Variety of health care and well-being benefits
Paid family/parental leave
We are a designated ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù for 2 years in a row! Learn more here
Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Most Loved Workplaces in America 2023 ‚Äì Learn more here

Automation Anywhere is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email recruiting@automationanywhere.com.

All unsolicited resumes submitted to any @automationanywhere.com email address, whether submitted by an individual or by an agency, will not be eligible for an agency fee.

About the job
Experience: 10.00 + years

Salary: INR 5000000.00 / year (based on experience)

Analytical Skills, automation, Ecommerce, GenAI, LangChain, Notion, Team management, Agile, Project management

Pet Health and Wellness Company is Looking for:
